title: DTT Atlas
description: Adds a bulk-cargo hauler, similar in specs to the Anaconda, but with 4 integral Passenger Berths.
author: Paradox

title: DTT Cyclops
description: Adds a large bulk-cargo hauler, along the lines of the Anaconda, but faster.
author: Paradox

title: DTT Galaxy Liner
description: Adds a player-flyable Luxury Cruise Liner.
author: Paradox

title: DTT Heart of Gold
description: Adds the famous 'Heart of Gold' spaceship from the BBC-TV series Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy.
author: Paradox

title: Heavy Metal Freight Hauler
description: Adds a semi-tractor/trailer like ship. Available in single and double trailer versions.
author: Paradox

title: DTT Kraken
description: A good mid-range cargo carrier, with 140 TC capacity and 6 missile plylons.
author: Paradox

title: DTT MK-1
description: Adds a general purpose cargo ship, with overall specs similar to a Cobra Mk-III.
author: Paradox

title: DTT Manta
description: A stylish and elegant all-rounder, roughly on a par with a Cobra Mk-III.
author: Paradox

title: DTT Planet Express
description: Adds the famous Planet Express delivery ship from the TV series Futurama.
author: Paradox

title: DTT Snake Charmer
description: Specs similar to a Cobra Mk III, but has 4 integral passenger berths built in.
author: Paradox

conflict_oxps.description: Cannot be installed along with the DTT Snake Charmer Pinup version. You must choose one or the other.

title: DTT Snake Charmer Pinup
description: Specs similar to a Cobra Mk III, but has 4 integral passenger berths built in, and the player version also has a sexy 'Snake Charmer' mural painted on the sides.
author: Paradox

conflict_oxps.description: Cannot be installed along with the regular DTT Snake Charmer. You must choose one or the other.

title: DTT Space Zeppelin
description: Adds a Steampunk-esque Zeppelin style cargo ship.
author: Paradox

title: DTT Tomahawk
description: This stylish and modern-looking general-purpose ship has slightly higher specs than a Cobrak Mk-III.
author: Paradox

title: DTT War Lance
description: Considered the \"Big Brother\" of the D.T.T. Tomahawk, the D.T.T. War Lance not only handles much more cargo, it packs a punch with 4 weapon positions. The War Lance was built to compete with the Boa Mk 2, and can be considered a respectable upgrade.
author: Paradox

title: DTT Wraith
description: The Wraith is an excellent bounty-hunter's ship.
author: Paradox

title: Cargo Scoop as Standard
description:
Awards Cargo Scoop to the player ship. Press 'i' for more information.
- - - - - - - - - -

Free cargo scoops mean that the beginning player can scoop debris.
However unlikely it may seem, they could now be a pirate or even a miner (pulse laser will rarely splinter asteroids but it can happen) from the start.

You can't scoop fuel with them but should you accidentally jettison some cargo or be lucky enough to stumble across some salvage then the goods are yours.
Also, when you buy your first new piece of equipment, there's a chance that something rather less important might get damaged instead.

A small boost at the start of a career.
author: Redspear

title: System Features: Rings
description: Adds ring systems to occasional planets. Requires a shader-capable graphics card to view.
author: cim, gsagostinho

title: gsagostinho's Cobra Mk. IV
description: The Cobra Mk. IV is the successor of the extremely popular Cobra Mk. III. This is the heavier of all Cobra ships, and a fine choice for a trader due to its increased cargo capacity, larger energy banks as well as faster energy recharge rate, all of which should make up for its somewhat slower velocity and manoeuvring speeds. This ship is available for both the player and the NPCs. This work is based on Griff's Cobra Mk. III Alternative model.
author: gsagostinho, Griff

title: Dangerous HUD Blue Variant
description: This is a HUD in the style of Elite Dangerous, featuring an blue theme for both the HUD and for the GUI, cockpit views (fighter, hauler or glass only), glass effect, monitor effect for aft view, new sounds effects (ECM, hyperjumps, low energy, missile warning), custom made warnings signs, HUD animations including a pulsating scanner. Based on phkb's Xenon HUD. Tested with vanilla Oolite as well as with BGS (Backgroundset) and Xenon UI OXPs, all of which work fine with the blue color scheme.
author: gsagostinho

title: Dangerous HUD Green Variant
description: This is a HUD in the style of Elite Dangerous, featuring an green theme for both the HUD and for the GUI, cockpit views (fighter, hauler or glass only), glass effect, monitor effect for aft view, new sounds effects (ECM, hyperjumps, low energy, missile warning), custom made warnings signs, HUD animations including a pulsating scanner. Based on phkb's Xenon HUD. Tested with vanilla Oolite as well as with BGS (Backgroundset) and Xenon UI OXPs, all of which work fine with the green color scheme.
author: gsagostinho

title: Dangerous HUD Orange Variant
description: This is a HUD in the style of Elite Dangerous, featuring an orange theme for both the HUD and for the GUI, cockpit views (fighter, hauler or glass only), glass effect, monitor effect for aft view, new sounds effects (ECM, hyperjumps, low energy, missile warning), custom made warnings signs, HUD animations including a pulsating scanner. Based on phkb's Xenon HUD. Tested with vanilla Oolite as well as with BGS (Backgroundset) and Xenon UI OXPs, all of which work fine with the orange color scheme.
author: gsagostinho

title: Dangerous HUD Pink Variant
description: This is a HUD in the style of Elite Dangerous, featuring an pink theme for both the HUD and for the GUI, cockpit views (fighter, hauler or glass only), glass effect, monitor effect for aft view, new sounds effects (ECM, hyperjumps, low energy, missile warning), custom made warnings signs, HUD animations including a pulsating scanner. Based on phkb's Xenon HUD. Tested with vanilla Oolite as well as with BGS (Backgroundset) and Xenon UI OXPs, all of which work fine with the pink color scheme.
author: gsagostinho

title: Dangerous HUD Purple Variant
description: This is a HUD in the style of Elite Dangerous, featuring an pink theme for both the HUD and for the GUI, cockpit views (fighter, hauler or glass only), glass effect, monitor effect for aft view, new sounds effects (ECM, hyperjumps, low energy, missile warning), custom made warnings signs, HUD animations including a pulsating scanner. Based on phkb's Xenon HUD. Tested with vanilla Oolite as well as with BGS (Backgroundset) and Xenon UI OXPs, all of which work fine with the pink color scheme.
author: gsagostinho

title: Dangerous HUD White Variant
description: This is a HUD in the style of Elite Dangerous, featuring an orange theme for both the HUD and for the GUI, cockpit views (fighter, hauler or glass only), glass effect, monitor effect for aft view, new sounds effects (ECM, hyperjumps, low energy, missile warning), custom made warnings signs, HUD animations including a pulsating scanner. Based on phkb's Xenon HUD. Tested with vanilla Oolite as well as with BGS (Backgroundset) and Xenon UI OXPs, all of which work fine with the orange color scheme.
author: gsagostinho

title: Dangerous Keyconfig
description: Alternative keyboard bindings similar to what is used in Elite Dangerous. Use 'a' and 'd' to yaw, 'TAB' for fuel injector, 't' for ident target, 'u' for weapons online/offline, 'PgUp' and 'PdDn' for scanner zoom, 'r' for target missile, 'R' for untarget missile, 'g' for activating primable equipment, '_' for cargo rotation, 'End' for dumping cargo, 'G' for galatic hyperdrive, '!' for fast activattion of equipment A (defensive) and '@' for fast activattion of equipment B (offensive).
author: gsagostinho

title: gsagostinho's Texture Pack: Adder
description: This bundle adds 6 new paint jobs for the Adder.
author: gsagostinho

title: gsagostinho's Texture Pack: Asp Mk II
description: This bundle adds 6 new paint jobs for the Asp Mk II.
author: gsagostinho

title: gsagostinho's Texture Pack: Cobra Mk III
description: This bundle adds 23 new paint jobs for the Cobra Mk III.
author: gsagostinho

title: gsagostinho's Texture Pack: Fer-de-Lance
description: This bundle adds 12 new paint jobs for the Fer-de-Lance.
author: gsagostinho

title: gsagostinho's Texture Pack: Python
description: This bundle adds 6 new paint jobs for the Python.
author: gsagostinho

title: The Classic Ooniverse Compilation
description: A compilation which allows users to install a set of modern OXZs which give the Ooniverse a quality retro Elite-style look.
author: Smivs

title: Jane's Galactic Shipset
description: Resizes and reattributes core shipset based on primary Elite sources. In many cases changes one or more of mass, speed, energy, recharge, missiles, cargo, pitch and roll statistics.
author: Redspear

title: Docked HUDs
description: Sleek, minimalist HUD design when docked. If you use a HUD expansion pack, instead of the standard HUD, check the forum for compatibility notes.
author: Wildeblood

title: Data - Ship Name
description: Do not download this. This is a component for use by HUD expansion packs, it is NOT a stand-alone expansion pack; it will be downloaded automatically by HUDs which need it.
author: Wildeblood

title: CompactHUD
description: Aegidean's CompactHUD, now with two MFDs, and the non-linear scanner and ultrazoom scanner features enabled.
author: Aegidean, Diziet Sma

title: Interface Reordering
description: Change interface order on F4 page (\"Ship and system interfaces\")
author: Alnivel

title: Route Planner
description: Plot a route through multiple systems
author: Alnivel

title: Bounty Informer
description: This device gives you access to the bounty registry of police criminal database.
author: Andrey Belov aka timer

title: Duplex Fuel Tank
description: Additional fuel tank (3LY) with duplex interaction with main tank. Improved technology allows not only to pump the fuel in the main tank, but also to make the opposite action, for example, in/after skimming process.
author: Andrey Belov aka timer

title: Target System Upgrade
description: Upgrade to the ships Target System that allows to cycle targeting between outlaw or neutral ships and cargoes on your scanner.
author: Andrey Belov

title: Cargo Wrecks Teaser
description: Adds diffent models of cargopods to the universe
author: Arexack Heretic

title: Thargorn Threat
description: Adds 3 powerfull thargoid ships to the game. A Terrorizer Frigate, the Thargorn Battleship and the Thorgorn Cruiser
author: Arexack Heretic

title: Armoured Transport Type 1
description: Adds Gaundlet's Armoured Transport Type 1 and Armoured Escort Viper that ferry valuables.
author: Arexack Heretic

title: Shaky Drive
description: Shaky Drive makes the ship shake and steer randomly while the Torus drive is engaged. Apply manual corrections to maintain desired heading
author: Astrobe

title: Adder start
description: Start with a 5TC Adder and 1000Cr.
author: Astrobe

title: Ebortsa's lucky charm
description: A tiny statue of Ebortsa, the tionislan goddess of nomads.
author: Astrobe

title: Space Crowds - Stellar Serpent
description: Adds the Stellar Serpents versus Vipers rare encounter to Space Crowds.
author: Astrobe

requires_oxps.description: This is a Space Crowds Add-on.

title: Better fuel injection for small ships
description:
Small ships burn less fuel when using injectors:
- Adder: -40%
- Moray: -24%
- Cobra MK1: -10%
- Fer De Lance: -10%
author: Astrobe

title: Wildships Kiota stations relocator
description: Restricts Wildships to spawn at most one Kiota station near the sun. Also prevents it from replacing main stations.
author: Astrobe

requires_oxps.description: relocates Kiota stations provided by Wildships

title: Surjectors
description: Your injectors burn almost no fuel when your weapons are offline, but your shields go offline too!
author: Astrobe

title: Life In The Frontier - Revival
description: (Phase 1) Creates a system BBS where the player can read and accept missions. Generates missions depending on system governments. Reward the player with credits and feedback, that in turn generates longer missions with better rewards.
author: BeeTLe BeTHLeHeM

title: Life In The Frontier
description: Roleplaying environment on space stations: go for a walk and get a casual event, that could bring an advantage or a risk, a reward or a trouble.
author: BeeTLe BeTHLeHeM, Norby

title: AutoRefuel
description: Automatically refills your fuel tank when you dock, subtracting the cost from your credits.
author: ByronArn

title: Breakable Energy Unit
description: This OXP make the ships core energy unit an equipment item that can be damaged in combat.
author: Capt Murphy

title: Breakable Engines
description: This OXP make the ships standard engines (or system drive) into a visible equipment item which can be damaged in combat.
author: Capt Murphy

title: Breakable HUD and IFF Scanner
description: This OXP makes the HUD and Scanner into equipment that can be damaged in combat.
author: Capt Murphy

title: Breakable Shield Generators
description: This OXP make the generators for the fore and aft shields into equipment items than can be damaged in combat.
author: Capt Murphy

title: Breakable Torus Drive
description: This OXP make the Torus or Jump Drive into an equipment item that can be damaged in combat.
author: Capt Murphy

title: Breakable Witch Drive
description: This OXP make the Thruspace Hyperdrive (or Witch Space Drive) into an equipment item that can be damaged in combat.
author: Capt Murphy

title: Escort Contracts
description: Start your Escort Contracts in the interfaces (F4) screen after you bought an ITHA license.
author: Capt. Murphy, Keeper, Norby, ZygoUgo, Fritz G.

title: Explorers' Club
description: Keeps a record of all the systems you visit and gives you an explorer rank. Lets you view your exploration achievements and provides a special Explorers Club long-range navigation chart.
author: Capt. Murphy & Wildeblood

title: Police IFF Scanner
description: An upgrade to the IFF Scanner System to show ships with offender or fugitive status in alternative scanner colours.
author: Capt. Murphy

title: Ship Storage Helper
description: A helper to other OXPs to store/restore current ship info. Required by Carriers, Combat Simulator, Hyperspace Hangar and Ship Respray.
author: Capt. Murphy, Norby

title: Cobra Mk III-XT
description: This is the upgraded Cobra Mk III originally known as the Xeceesian Transformation
author: CaptSolo

title: Addons for Beginners (Vital Statistics)
description:
Vital information packages for new pilots to help master Oolite. On the Expansions Manager, press \"i\" for the list. This pack does nothing after installed, so you can remove it and then also remove any unwanted packages.

Installs: Ship's Library with ship's manual, Technical Reference Library (identifies many ships), XenonUI (identifies many key commands), GalCop Galactic Registry (guide to the galaxy), Galactic Almanac (guide to local system), Market Observer (vital market information), Hints (overhear useful tittle-tattle about combat, trade, etc. at the local bar) & Vimana-X HUD (flashes warnings for Incoming Missiles, High Temperature, Low Altitude, Energy & Shields).

Optional: HUD selector.

Warning: do not install this collection if you plan to read through the entire oxp/oxz list (1,100+!) and can spend enough time to build up your very unique Ooniverse.
author: Cholmondeley

requires_oxps.description: Technical Reference Library - data on targeted ships
Market Ads - adverts for Market Observer

title: Lore Collection (Classic Elite)
description:
A collection of oxp's to make your Ooniverse resemble that of the Dark Wheel/Classic Elite Press \"i\" for the installation list. This pack does nothing after being installed so you can remove it and then remove any unwanted packages.

Installs: FPO Lave, Lave Academy, Tionisla Orbital GraveYard, Generation Ships, Deep Space Dredgers, Liners, BigShips, Griff Moray, Energy Bomb & New Cargoes.

Warning: do not install this collection if you plan to read through the whole addon list and can spend enough time to build up your very unique Ooniverse.
author: Cholmondeley

requires_oxps.description: TOGY - the famous Tionisla Orbital GraveYard
Monuments adds more realistic monuments to TOGY
Shipwrecks adds more realistic ships to TOGY
Jane's shipset restores the Classic Elite ship definitions
Deep Space Dredgers as mentioned in the Pilot's Manual
Generation Ships as mentioned in the Pilot's Manual
Liners as mentioned in the Dark Wheel
Ophidian yacht as mentioned in the Dark Wheel
New Cargoes allows trade in Dark Wheel goods such as Shanaskilk furs

title: Broadcast Comms - Digebiti Variations
description: Alters BCC responses to be more inline with the cultured expressions of a native of Digebiti.
author: Cholmondely, phkb and Zireael

title: Hints
description: Hints in space stations: visit the bar and eavesdrop on experienced pilots
author: Cholmondely, Littlebear, Spara, Redspear, Hiran, Murgh and Cody
license: in theory: CC BY-NC-SA 4 but in practice: Killer Wolf special

title: MincePie
description: Santa likes mince pies. Putting one out is a sure way to make sure he'll come to your system - though his sense of smell isn't that good, so he will have to be within range of the pie to attract him in. Sit near the pie to see Santa eat. Mince pies work like mines so you need space in your rack to buy one (using F3 for equipment). Like Santa, mince pies are time of year limited.
author: Chris

title: Kirin
description: A heavy military hauler, CV & XM versions used by both pirates & traders
author: ClymAngus

title: Kirin Sport
description: The civilian chopped sport version of the Kirin
author: ClymAngus

title: NeoCaduceus
description: The very expensive (and deadly) Caduceus
author: ClymAngus

title: Deep Horizon Advanced Navigation Computer
description: Adds a primeable piece of equipment that improves interstellar navigation in the form of fuel savings.
author: Cmd. Cheyd, PhantorGorth

title: Deep Horizon Emergency Witchspace Initiator
description: Adds a prime-able piece of equipment that improves the countdown time required to initiate a hyperspace (or witchspace) jump, but at a cost.
author: Cmd. Cheyd

title: Deposed
description: This is a series of missions starting in galaxy 4. Needs 1700 kills to start.
author: Cmdr. Wombat

title: Thargoid Wars
description: Adds several thargoid related missions in galaxy 2 and higher
author: Cmdr. Wombat

title: Anarchies
description: In certain Anarchy-systems you will find Hacker Outposts, Salvage Gangs, Sentinel Stations or Renegade Stations. Depending on your legal status these may be more or less useful to you, and docking with them may be more or less dangerous to you.
author: Commander McLane, Killer Wolf, Arexack Heretic, Eric Walch, spara, Norby, phkb and Griff

title: Auto Eject
description: This equipment ejects your escape pod automatically when your energy becomes too low.
author: Commander McLane

title: Display reputation
description: Your current reputations as a passenger ferrier, a parcel deliverer and a contract cargo carrier are displayed as a human readable string on your ship's manifest screen.
author: Commander McLane

title: Fireworks
description: This OXP allows you to celebrate your latest achievements with fireworks.
author: Commander McLane

title: Flying Dutchman
description: This OXP introduces the small possibility to encounter a ghost ship.
author: Commander McLane

title: Interstellar Help
description: Introduces some interaction with fellow commanders in interstellar space, who might come to the player's rescue if they're stranded, or the player could be asked for help from other stranded ships.
author: Commander McLane

title: Randomshipnames
description: Adds interesting randomly generated names to normal ship classes.
author: Commander McLane

title: Sell Equipment
description: Allows to resell most original equipments and some more in stations with the same techlevel necessary to buy the equipment. The resell value is generally 60 per cent of the original recommended retail price.
author: Commander McLane

title: Total patrol
description: Makes additional police ships patrol between planet-sun and sun-witchpoint. Nowadays there are some without this addon also but more with this.
author: Commander McLane

title: CustomShields
description: Shield flasher and damage effects, forward/aft shield simulation for the NPCs.
author: CommonSenseOTB
license: CC BY-NC-SA 3 with clauses, see in the readme.txt

title: NumericHUD
description: Display ship data in numeric form.
author: CommonSenseOTB
license: CC BY-NC-SA 3 with clauses, see in the readme.txt

title: Q-Charger
description: Provides a boost in speed when at maximum throttle at the cost of some fuel and energy.
author: CommonSenseOTB, Norby

title: ShieldEqualizer+Capacitors
description: Equalizer balances the energy in the forward and aft shields. Capacitors are charging when the shield is full and recharge shields automatically if needed.
author: CommonSenseOTB

title: SniperLock
description: SniperLock software allows for more accurate targetting by enabling longer dwell times on targets.
author: CommonSenseOTB

title: Diplomacy
description:
WIP: wars maps and History! GNN news concerning alliances and wars! Treasuries! Citizenships! Taxes!
Systems treasury! Wars require money, and countries are defeated either by battles or by bankruptcy, sometimes the latter producing the former.
Strategic maps! New F4 Interface screens: the Wars Map! The Diplomatic Map!
Systems alliances, wars! Two systems within 7ly of each other may now form an alliance, break their alliance, wage war on each other, and make peace too :) !
News! Some GNN news are now displayed when alliance/break/war/peace happens, and the player is in one of those systems.
Citizenships! The player may acquire, or renounce, a system citizenship when visiting this system, for the right price. They may choose which of their citizenships is displayed as their flagship. The player is considered fugitive when in systems warring with their flag. The player may buy visas in the Embassy district.
author: Day

requires_oxps.description: GNN OXP: adds the galactic news network channels.
Anarchies OXP: adds the attackers in the systems at war with the player flag.

title: Mining Contracts
description: Excavate asteroids for reward with deadline conditions.
author: Diagoras

title: Free Trade Zones
description: Adds Free Trade Zones to Multi-Government systems (TL7+).
author: Disembodied, Griff, phkb

title: Q-Bomb-Detector
description: Detects the launch of a Quirium Cascade Mine and sounds a siren to alert the pilot.
author: Diziet Sma

title: Hyperradio CATACLYSM - Electronica
description: This musicpack contains the Electronica album '+cataclysm+'. Depends on Hyperradio.
author: Diziet Sma

title: Commies
description: Adds Astro Mines, Factories, Production Units, Commuters & special police ships to Communist systems.
author: Amaranth, Dr. Nil, Eric Walch, Norby, phkb, GearsNSuch

title: Your Ad Here
description: Adds advertising billboards and constores to various systems
author: Dr. Nil and contributors
license: Creative Commons Attribution - Non-Commercial - Share Alike 4.0 license

title: Your Ad Here Set A
description: Advert set A for YAH - Pi47
author: Dr. Nil and contributors
license: Creative Commons Attribution - Non-Commercial - Share Alike 4.0 license

title: Your Ad Here Set B
description: Advert set B for YAH - Tescoo
author: Dr. Nil and contributors
license: Creative Commons Attribution - Non-Commercial - Share Alike 4.0 license

title: Your Ad Here Set C
description: Advert set C for YAH - Mallwart
author: Dr. Nil and contributors
license: Creative Commons Attribution - Non-Commercial - Share Alike 4.0 license

title: Your Ad Here Set D
description: Advert set D for YAH - GalaxyMart
author: Dr. Nil and contributors
license: Creative Commons Attribution - Non-Commercial - Share Alike 4.0 license

title: Your Ad Here Set E
description: Advert set E for YAH - Sainsboory's
author: Dr. Nil and contributors
license: Creative Commons Attribution - Non-Commercial - Share Alike 4.0 license

title: Your Ad Here Set F
description: Advert set F for YAH - Star
author: Dr. Nil and contributors
license: Creative Commons Attribution - Non-Commercial - Share Alike 4.0 license

title: Your Ad Here Set G
description: Advert set G for YAH - Oodles
author: Dr. Nil and contributors
license: Creative Commons Attribution - Non-Commercial - Share Alike 4.0 license

title: In System Trader
description: Introduces a living market to systems with rewards and risks for in system trading.
author: Dr.Tripsa

title: Generation Ships
description: Adds encounters with the mythical Generation Ships from time to time in interstellar space. GalCop regulations stipulate these enormous pre-witchspace drive ships should be left completely alone when found. There are serious consequences for attempting to interfere with them in any way.
author: Draco Caeles, Commander McLane, phkb

title: Tianve Pulsar
description: Adds the famous Tianve Pulsar to the Tianve system
author: Drew Wagar

title: Deep Space Dredger
description: Dredgers operate mainly in deep space as mobile shipyards and markets, scooping up wreckage, hydrogen and space dust. Salvage drones are offered to a clean player to launch as a missile to derelict ships. Super Dredgers can launch big ships also.
author: Captain Berf, Eric Walch, Little Bear, Norby, Sabre, phkb, spara

title: Deep Space Pirates
description: Adds aditional pirates outside the mail trading lanes.
author: Eric Walch

requires_oxps.description: Library is a collection of useful snippets, helpers and resources to simplify some common tasks used by AddOns.

title: Misjump Analyser
description: The blueprint for this scanner is retrieved from a captured thargoid ship after a minor battle in the Najort nebula.
author: Eric Walch

title: Missile Analyser
description: Recognises missile types on launch.
author: Eric Walch

title: Pirate Cove
description: Adds pirate bases to te system that are situated in rock hermits.
author: Lazy Gun & Eric Walch

title: Tionisla Reporter
description: Have you always wanted to explore the universe beyond its boundaries? Then this mission has something for you. The head of the Tionisla Chronicle will send you out to fetch material for an article that will make headlines. And you are the author of it.
author: Eric Walsh, phkb

title: UPS Courier
description: This OXP adds several random missions that run simultaneously. The first set of missions offered will be various transport missions. After you have run enough of these, a series of combat jobs will be offered. Update to the original by Eric Walsh, with contributions from spara, Keeper and phkb.
author: Eric Walch, spara, Keeper, phkb, Rorschachhamster

title: Fuel Collector
description: Fuel Collector scoops fuel from killed ships and collects fuel while cruising, even in witch space.
author: Frame

title: Navigation Flashers
description: Adds flashers to docking navigation buoys to increase visibility.
author: Fritz G.

title: Synchronised Torus
description: Enables torus drive synchronisation with NPC ships escorted by the player.
author: Fritz G.

title: Ionics
description: Ionics aims to enhance the northeast corner of Galaxy 2 with a number of interlocking missions revolving around a rich storyline.
author: Galileo

title: VimanaHUD
description: The Vimana HUD is the newest in spaceship cockpits, with all functions and features gathered in a slick futuristic design. It changes IFF scanner color based on conditions (Deepspace/Mass-Locked/Alert). New crosshairs compatible with AutoCrosHair. WARNING: The ship overrides that increased cargo space were moved to VimanaShipOverrides OXP (listed in Ships category) - install that OXP before loading a savefile of a core game ship or cargo may be lost!
author: Gnievmir

title: Vimana Ship Overrides
description: Makes VimanaHUD the HUD for many ships, but also changes cargo capacity, speed, pylons quantity
author: Gnievmir

title: Griff Adder
description: Griff Adder. Requires a video card capable of supporting Oolite Shaders. Note - this OXP suppresses the spawning of the Default Oolite Adder, replacing it with the version in this oxp
author: Griff

title: Griff Anaconda
description: Anaconda. Requires a video card capable of supporting Oolite Shaders. Note - this OXP suppresses the spawning of the Default Oolite Anaconda, replacing it with the version in this oxp
author: Griff

title: Griff Asp
description: Asp. Requires a video card capable of supporting Oolite Shaders. Note - this OXP suppresses the spawning of the Default Oolite Asp, replacing it with the version in this oxp
author: Griff

title: Griff Asteroids
description: Griff Asteroids Bundle. Requires a video card capable of supporting Oolite Shaders.
author: Griff

title: Griff Boa
description: Boa. Requires a video card capable of supporting Oolite Shaders. Note - this OXP suppresses the spawning of the Default Oolite Boa, replacing it with the version in this oxp
author: Griff

title: Griff Boa_MkII
description: Boa_MkII. Requires a video card capable of supporting Oolite Shaders. Note - this OXP suppresses the spawning of the Default Oolite Boa_MkII, replacing it with the version in this oxp
author: Griff

title: Bug
description: The 'Bug' trader from the aborted Elite 2 project by Braben & Bell. Requires a video card capable of supporting Oolite Shaders
author: Griff

title: Griff Cargopod
description: Cargopod. Requires a video card capable of supporting Oolite Shaders. Note - this OXP suppresses the spawning of the Default Oolite Cargopod, replacing it with the version in this oxp
author: Griff

title: Griff Cobra MkIII Alt
description: Alternative Highpoly version of the Cobra Mk III. Requires a video card capable of supporting Oolite Shaders
author: Griff

title: Griff Cobra MkI
description: Cobra Mk I. Requires a video card capable of supporting Oolite Shaders. Note - this OXP suppresses the spawning of the Default Oolite Cobra Mk I, replacing it with the version in this oxp
author: Griff

title: Griff Cobra MkIII
description: Cobra Mk III. Requires a video card capable of supporting Oolite Shaders. Note - this OXP suppresses the spawning of the Default Oolite Cobra Mk III, replacing it with the version in this oxp
author: Griff

title: Subentity Missiles for Griff Cobra MkIII
description: Subentity Missiles for NPC Cobra Mk III. Requires a video card capable of supporting Oolite Shaders.
author: Griff

title: Griff Constrictor
description: Constrictor. Requires a video card capable of supporting Oolite Shaders. Note - this OXP suppresses the spawning of the Default Oolite Constrictor, replacing it with the version in this oxp
author: Griff

title: Griff Escape Capsule
description: Escape Capsule. Requires a video card capable of supporting Oolite Shaders. Note - this OXP suppresses the spawning of the Default Oolite Escape Capsule, replacing it with the version in this oxp
author: Griff

title: Griff Ferdelance
description: Ferdelance. Requires a video card capable of supporting Oolite Shaders. Note - this OXP suppresses the spawning of the Default Oolite Ferdelance, replacing it with the version in this oxp
author: Griff

title: Griff Gecko
description: Gecko. Requires a video card capable of supporting Oolite Shaders. Note - this OXP suppresses the spawning of the Default Oolite Gecko, replacing it with the version in this oxp
author: Griff

title: Gnat
description: The 'Gnat', a small fighter from the aborted Elite 2 project by Braben & Bell. Requires a video card capable of supporting Oolite Shaders
author: Griff

title: Griff Shipset Decals
description: Decal textures for Griff's ships. Install this oxp to avoid having a massive blank, empty square appearing on your Griff shipset ship hull. Requires a video card capable of supporting Oolite Shaders
author: Griff

title: Griffin Mk I
description: The 'Griffin Mk I' trader from the aborted Elite 2 project by Braben & Bell. Requires a video card capable of supporting Oolite Shaders
author: Griff

title: Hognose
description: The 'Hognose' from the Acorn Archimedes version of the original Elite. Requires a video card capable of supporting Oolite Shaders. This ship is not Player flyable
author: Griff

title: Griff Krait
description: Krait. Requires a video card capable of supporting Oolite Shaders. Note - this OXP suppresses the spawning of the Default Oolite Krait, replacing it with the version in this oxp
author: Griff

title: Griff Mamba
description: Mamba. Requires a video card capable of supporting Oolite Shaders. Note - this OXP suppresses the spawning of the Default Oolite Mamba, replacing it with the version in this oxp
author: Griff

title: Griff Mamba Alternative
description: Mamba, alternative texture version. Requires a video card capable of supporting Oolite Shaders. Note - this OXP suppresses the spawning of the Default Oolite Mamba, replacing it with the version in this oxp
author: Griff

title: Griff Missiles
description: Missiles. Requires a video card capable of supporting Oolite Shaders. Note - this OXP suppresses the spawning of the Default Oolite Missile and ECM Proof Missile, replacing it with the versions in this oxp
author: Griff

title: Griff Moray
description: Moray. Requires a video card capable of supporting Oolite Shaders. Note - this OXP suppresses the spawning of the Default Oolite Moray, replacing it with the version in this oxp
author: Griff

title: Ophidian
description: The 'Ophidan' trader from Angus Duggan's Elite-A. Requires a video card capable of supporting Oolite Shaders
author: Griff

title: Griff Prototype Boa
description: Griff Prototype Boa. Requires a video card capable of supporting Oolite Shaders
author: Griff

title: Griff Python
description: Python. Requires a video card capable of supporting Oolite Shaders. Note - this OXP suppresses the spawning of the Default Oolite Python, replacing it with the version in this oxp
author: Griff

title: Santa
description: Santa watch the system clock and take off within Christmas time only. If you defeat his ship then you can scoop Santa's Lists with the names of good childrens. Deliver it to the main station for some reward.
author: Griff, Littlebear

title: Griff Shuttle
description: Shuttle. Requires a video card capable of supporting Oolite Shaders. Note - this OXP suppresses the spawning of the Default Oolite Shuttle, replacing it with the version in this oxp
author: Griff

title: Griff Sidewinder
description: Sidewinder. Requires a video card capable of supporting Oolite Shaders. Note - this OXP suppresses the spawning of the Default Oolite Sidewinder, replacing it with the version in this oxp
author: Griff

title: SpecGloss_Sidewinder
description: A version of Sidewinder with shaders based on Oolite's new Specular-Gloss lighting model. Includes a player flyable version which has no Hyperdrive capability
author: Griff

title: Start in a Griff Cobra MkIII
description: Start in a Griff Cobra III. Requires a video card capable of supporting Oolite Shaders. Note - this OXP swaps the defaul player Cobra III  for the Griff version
author: Griff

title: Griff Station Bundle
description: Large texture reskins for the Coriolis, Dodo, Ico and Rock Hermit Stations. Requires a video card capable of supporting Oolite Shaders. This oxz includes a 'shipdata-overrides.plist' file that stops the default Oolite station models from spawning
author: Griff

title: Griff Thargoids
description: Thargoids. Requires a video card capable of supporting Oolite Shaders. Note - this OXP suppresses the spawning of the default Oolite Thargoid and Tharglet, replacing them with the versions in this oxp
author: Griff

title: Griff Transporter
description: Transporter. Requires a video card capable of supporting Oolite Shaders. Note - this OXP suppresses the spawning of the Default Oolite Transporter, replacing it with the version in this oxp
author: Griff

title: Griff Viper
description: Viper. Requires a video card capable of supporting Oolite Shaders. Note - this OXP suppresses the spawning of the Default Oolite Vipers, replacing them with the versions in this oxp
author: Griff

title: Viper Interceptor_exp
description: Highpoly remake of the Oolite Viper Interceptor. Requires a video card capable of supporting Oolite Shaders
author: Griff

title: Viper_exp
description: High poly model version of the Viper. Requires a video card capable of supporting Oolite Shaders.
author: Griff

title: Wolf Mk II
description: The 'Wolf MK II' pirate raider from the Amiga version of the original Elite. Requires a video card capable of supporting Oolite Shaders
author: Griff

title: Griff Worm
description: Worm. Requires a video card capable of supporting Oolite Shaders. Note - this OXP suppresses the spawning of the Default Oolite Worm, replacing it with the version in this oxp
author: Griff

title: Griff Alloys and Wreckage
description: Alloys and Wreckage. Requires a video card capable of supporting Oolite Shaders.
author: Griff

title: Love Cats
description: A tale of love and betrayal amongst the vicious furry feline races of galaxy four.
author: John Smith

title: Font: Tty
description: Based on the 'Cella' Font by Volker Busse (http://www.fontpalace.com/font-download/Cella/)
author: Kaks

title: King Cobra
description: Adds the King Cobra to the Ooniverse.
author: KillerWolf

title: Adder Mark III
description: Isis Interstellar's upgrade of the old and maligned ship. Aimed at small-time and new traders, the ship has improved speed and cargo capacity. An ideal 'stepping stone' ship for those aspiring towards a big trader like a Cobra Mark III.
author: Killer_Wolf, Montana05

title: Steampunk HUD
description: Elegant HUD designed by an aesthete (Killer Wolf). The contrast lens is foldable by those who can tweak. The scanner needs some TLC.
author: Killer Wolf

title: Reaistic Stars
description: To give OoLite a more realistic Ambience, this OXP sets various universal settings to match the colours we can see in the night sky. The numbers of stars has also been set to match what the average eye can see in this part of the galaxy (which would vary if you were moving significant distances in a real galaxy, but not over 50 light years :-) ), with a more natural light ambient_level, and the Sun's been moved to give it a more realistic size when near the planet (you might notice this when skimming)
author: Knotty

title: Realistic Stars SSC
description: Sensible Sun Compatable: To give OoLite a more realistic Ambience, this sets universal settings to match the colours we can see in the night sky. The numbers of stars has also been set to match what the average eye can see in this part of the galaxy, with a more natural light ambient_level, and the Sun's been moved to give it a more realistic size when near the planet (you might notice this when skimming)
author: Knotty

title: MvM Veloce e Appuntita
description: The Marziani verdi Martelli Veloce e Appuntita is the utimate super Grand tourer for exhilarating performace and unparalleled comfort. It's smooth lines hide the raw power of the most powerful sub light engines placed in a spaceframe, and it's tentacle crafted cabin ensures absolute luxury wherever you go. A multitude of colour options with a high spec of standard features (*convertable option no longer available). For even greater performance, a Sport Edition is avaliable, with 10% higher top speed.
author: Knotty

title: Docking Fees
description: Adds a small docking fee and docking messages to all GalCop stations based on system tech level.  Many OXP stations are also given unique fees or docking messages.
author: Layne & Eris

title: Assassins Guild
description: Assassins Guild is a semi-mythical association said to operate in Galaxy 7. A killer who can secure membership of \"The Brotherhood\" can expect huge rewards, and the most unpleasant consequences for failure. This OXP still uses legacy scripts, but it is presumed to work... the ships at least should be fine
author: LittleBear

title: Asteroid Storm
description: This OXP adds more models and textures for asteroids to the game and as bonus one mission.
author: Little Bear, Eric Walch

title: Galactic Almanac
description: Adds unique and persistent names to all stars, planets, gas giants, asteroids and space stations in all 2,048 star systems. Also adds a list of all artificial and natural satellites to the F4 Screen and a purchasable MFD Unit to view information whilst in flight. Version 0.91 is compatible with all OXZs except its own Alpha Version (Random Station Names).
author: LittleBear

conflict_oxps.description: Not Compatible with its own Alpha Version as the Alpha's script will over-ride the Galactic Almanac's script!

title: Random Station Names
description: Assigns random names to stations throughout the Ooniverse. In the future these names will be persistent, but for now they change every time you load a saved game or re-enter a system from witchspace.
author: LittleBear

title: ETT Homing Beacon
description: Marks a position in space by deploying a pylon-mounted beacon.
author: Lone Wolf, Twisted

title: Naval Grid Next
description: Enhanced energy grid to link the energy units to the shields, enhancing recharging rates. There is a civilian and a naval version, requiring an Extra or  Naval Energy Unit.
author: Lone_Wolf

conflict_oxps.description: Military-grade energy grid to properly link the naval energy unit to military-boosted shields, enhancing recharging rates.

title: Reduce Weapon Damage
description: Reduce damage of lasers to player & most npc-ships
author: Lone_Wolf

title: Shield Cycler
description: Distributes shield energy between fore and aft shields. Adjustable with OXPConfig.
author: Lone_Wolf

conflict_oxps.description: development version of ShieldCycler

requires_oxps.description: Collection of snippets and helpers for OXPs.
oxpConfig 2.3.1 or a later version from the 2.x.y series

title: Shield Cycler Next
description: Distributes shield energy between fore and aft shields.
author: Lone_Wolf

conflict_oxps.description: previous stable version of ShieldCycler

requires_oxps.description: In-game configuration through Config for AddOns at Station Interfaces (F4)

title: HoOpy Casino
description: Commanders who chose to dock with a HoOpy Casino are quickly ushered into the vast gaming halls, here to be offered the opportunity to win or lose credits in games of chance.
author: Eric Walch, Murgh, CaptSolo, spara

title: Military Fiasco
description: Equips the Galactic Navy with the powerful Leviathan Cruiser, supported by the Military Wolf Mark II, the Basilisk, the Hydra and the Rattle Cutter. These ships are occasionally seen in the space lanes, but are more often encountered in Witch Space fighting the Thargoid menace. Also adds a mission that can start in any galaxy.
author: Murgh

title: Nu Vipers
description: Increases the types of Viper patrol ships with GalCop Viper Mark II and GalCop Viper Cruiser.
author: Murgh

title: Vacuum Pump
description: Consolidates multiple small quantities of Gold, Platinum or Gem Stones into the minimum number of Tonne Containers that they will fit into.
author: Neelix

title: Waypoint Here
description: Allows you to set up to 8 waypoints to mark your current location so you can find your way back there later. Does not use any missile pylons.
author: Neelix

title: Mining IFF Scanner Upgrade
description:
An upgrade to the IFF Scanner System to show asteroids, boulders and splinters in alternate colours for easier tracking when mining:  Asteroids are white/gray, Boulders white/orange and Splinters white/green. With an optional tweak to the scanner, cargo pods and escape pods can be included as white/cyan and white/purple respectively.

Updated by Milo to make the scanner upgrade equipment portable between ships, optimize status checks, change refund amount to full price as described (was coded as 10%), improve compatibility with OXPs that add cargo pods with non-standard names, improve compatibility with OXPs that manage ship equipment (e.g., Ship Storage Helper, Ship Configuration), and let other OXPs' IFF colour overrides take priority (Asteroid Storm, Rescue Stations, Curse of the Black Sunspot, etc.).
author: NewtSoup, Milo

title: N-Shields
description: Fair NPC fore/aft shield simulation and associated visual effects, intended as an improved alternative to the CustomShields and NPC-Shields OXPs.
author: Ngalo

conflict_oxps.description: Identifier changed to standard format after version 0.5.3 of this OXP
Similar functionality.
The compatibility script for early versions of Ship Configuration OXP has been removed in N-Shields 0.7 as current Ship Configuration versions (0.2.0 or later) include the necessary code themselves.

optional_oxps.description: Helps balance this OXP by allowing NPC equipment to be damaged when shields are down
Allowing NPCs to fit extra energy units is important for fairness if they have proper Military Shield Enhancers
enables NPC's civilian and naval energy units
upgrades shield recharge rate for ships with enough energy recharge
Awards a bunch of equipment to NPCs.

title: NPC Equipment Damage
description: Randomly damages NPC equipment, imitating what Oolite does for player-ship internal damage as far as possible.
author: Ngalo, phkb, tsoj

optional_oxps.description: This OXP is designed to work with N-Shields, if installed.
This OXP can interact with ShipConfiguration to correctly damage most of the extra equipment that OXP provides.

title: Addons for Beginners
description:
Useful packages for new pilots collected by Norby to get the most wanted addons easily. Press \"i\" for the installation list. This pack does nothing after installed once so you can remove it then remove any unwanted packages.

Install: Ambience Collection (about 50 graphical and polishment packages), AutoRefuel, Combat Simulator, ETT Homing Beacon, Miner Cobra, Neo-Docklights, Lave Academy, Tionisla Reporter, Traffic Control, Reverse Control, Ring Racer, Safety Catch, Start Advice, The Collector, Welcome Mat.

Optional: ILS Instrument Landing System, Market Inquirer, Torus To Sun, Total Patrol, Variable Masslock.

Warning: do not install this collection if you plan to read through the whole addon list and can spend enough time to build up your very unique Ooniverse.
author: Norby

title: Ambience Collection
description:
Install many graphical packs at once and similars for better look and feel without changing the gameplay. Press 'i' to see the full list. You can remove this and others which is not in your taste after installed once.

Install: Asteroid Storm, BetterBuoys, BackGroundSet, BGS Soundset by P.A. Groove, Cabal Common Library, Camera Drones, Captain Solo's Good Fortune, Combat MFD, Commanders Log, Communications Pack A, Contracted Goods Reminder, Delightful Docking, Display reputation, Email System, Explorers' Club, Extracts from the Tre Clan, Famous Planets, Fireworks, Flight Log, Freighter Convoys, Gallery, Griff Station Bundle, HD Backgrounds, HUDSelector, Hyperradio, Icesteroids, LogEvents, Market Observer, MFD - CommsLog, MFD - Manifest, MFD - Navigation, Randomshipnames, Random Player/Ship Name, Satellites, Snoopers, Ship Respray, Ship Storage Helper, Ship's Library with Mutabilis and Status Quo, System Features: Rings and Sunspots, TrackerCam, Trails, Trophy Collector, OXPConfig.
author: Norby

requires_oxps.description: Additional Planets SR Others Gas Giants pack
Combat MFD with custom HUD dials

title: Ambiences recommended by Norby
description:
For at least Competent commanders this collection install many packs at once for better look and feel. Press 'i' to see the full list. Beginners should use the 'Ambience Collection' only. You can remove packages not in your taste after installation.

Install: Additional Planets, Ambience Collection, Docking Fees, Escort Formations, Headlights, MFD - BroadcastComms, Planetary Compass, Realistic Stars, Start Choices.
author: Norby

requires_oxps.description: Additional Planets SR Others Gas Giants pack

title: Andromeda
description: The famous Andromeda spaceship is a strong mobile base with huge cargo capacity.
author: Norby

title: Carriers
description: Build up your personal fleet and take with you on your Carrier. Requires EscortDeck OXP and Ship Storage Helper OXP.
author: Norby

title: Carriers with turrets
description: Short range turrets applied on Carriers as a big help in close defese. Requires Carriers OXP.
author: Norby

title: MFD - Combat MFD
description: Makes the Multi-Function Displays more useful by displaying some info from your ship and your target. Fill up 40 custom HUD dials with useful values for HUDs in HUDSelector.
author: Norby, Zireael

title: Convoys
description: Freighters can fly in large groups occasionally. Small ships also make larger formations sometimes to defend themselves, as well as pirates, hunters and police, especially in bad governments. Leaders of convoys are usually well armed ships but local authorities pay very high bounties for the most wanted fugitive leaders.
author: Norby

title: Convoy leaders without bounty labels
description: Names of fugitive convoy leaders will not contain the words 'high bounty'. Just less marked, but the bounty is not changed and still the same very strong ship so you should keep in mind that a fugitive leader is a serious threat. A new pilot should not install this package to keep the warning.
author: Norby

title: Eco Lasers
description: Economical Lasers are developed for separated multiple mounts where energy usage is important. Eco Laser and Eco Cannon are strong but short range (5km) weapons, Eco Artillery is the strongest and long range (20km) but cost 400kCr. Eco Reactor is not a weapon but restore energy, useful in side mounts - a life saver in emergency.
author: Norby

title: Engine Sound
description: The tone of engine sound follow the speed of your ship.
author: Norby

title: Escort Deck
description: Build up your escort fleet and hold on an external deck attached to your ship. Salvage damaged ships for cash.
author: Norby

optional_oxps.description: In-game configuration through Config for AddOns at Station Interfaces (F4)

title: Escort Pack
description: Various escort ships, useful for Escort Deck.
author: Norby

title: Fighters
description: Tiny ships can use your cargo space as hangar: launch and attack your hostiles automatically. Finish core missions or travel to far galaxies for better fighters. You can control 8 fighters at once by default, buy a Fighter Bay to handle 16 and allow heavy fighters on board. The best hybrid types require Alien Items from Tharglets.
author: Norby, Shipbuilder, Thargoid, Killer Wolf, Knotty

title: Freighter Convoys
description: Freighters can fly in large groups sometimes, even in the less harmful governments. This is a small variant of Convoys OXP to fit into the Ambience category. You can also install Convoys in the Mechanics category if you want, these two complement each other.
author: Norby

title: Gallery
description: Show and zoom ships, meet Exhibitions and gain Visitor Levels.
author: Norby

title: Gatling Laser
description: Fast laser with internal cooler to be usable soon after overheat. Hold down the fire button when overheated to force the built-in cooler to dissipate the heat as fast as possible. Range is 10km only and need a ship over 130t like Cobra Mark III.
author: Norby

title: HD Backgrounds
description: Show station specific high resolution background images on Arrival Reports. Docking Fees OXP can help to see these more times. Prepared mission screens can use these images also. System screens are unchanged (handled by BackGroundSet, Better Screens and Xenon UI).
author: Norby

title: HD Backgrounds Image Pack A
description: Set of HD and UHD images for arrival reports and mission screens in core stations. Depends on HD Backgrounds OXP.
author: Norby

title: HUD Selector with Large HUD
description: Change your HUD during flight between the supported ones. You can set your default MFDs and Scanner settings for any HUD. Contains ExtraLarge, Large and Small HUDs, all with 10 MFDs.
author: Norby

title: HardShips
description: Ships get 6 side armours, 10 Hard ships with Hard Armour, many new defensive equipments and Drones.
author: Norby

optional_oxps.description: Needed to put Hard Shields into NPC ships.
Needed if you want to use Big Shield Capacitors.
NPCs will get IronHide armour also if HardShips present.
Award equipments from HardShips OXP to NPCs.

title: Headlights
description: Tune the light level with this primable equipment on the dark side of objects like you have powerful headlights.
author: Norby

title: ILS Instrument Landing System
description: ILS will guide your ship into the dock of the station you targeted. The speed controls are in your hand so you can ignite Injectors to arrive faster or stop to avoid collisions. Other ships will dock much faster using short path and injectors - effectively cure traffic jams near stations when you are waiting for landing clearance.
author: Norby

title: Laser Cannons
description: Laser Cannons are developed from Mining Lasers. Consume more energy and cause extreme heat, but a single shot deliver similar damage than a series of Beam Lasers. Fit into large ships only except Mini Cannons, usually short ranged and must aim carefully. Pilots tend to eject from cannon hits when energy is low.
author: Norby

title: Laser Cooler
description: Turn off and on your hot weapons to attach the Cooler then fire until heat is dissipated. Need much energy, fuel and a ship over 130t mass.
author: Norby

title: LogEvents
description: Write messages into Latest.log using all event handlers to help debugging and review battles and messages.
author: Norby

title: Miner Cobra
description: Modified Cobra Mark III for miners: 75t cargo, miner laser and scoop in change of less energy, recharge and missile pylons.
author: Norby, Griff, Z_GrOovy

title: Multiple Lasers
description:
Dual Lasers: Boa, Fer-de-Lance, Cat, Ghavial, Iguana, Python, Vector, Viper and more. Triple Lasers: Anaconda, Arachnid, Caduceus, Chameleon, Chopped Cobra/S9, Cobra III, Cobra Clipper/Rapier/Cutlass, DTT War Lance, Hornet, King Cobra, Krait, S8, WolfII. Quad Lasers: Boa Class Cruiser, Mussurana, Pitviper II. Press 'i' for more.
Aft Dual Lasers: Boa Class Cruiser (Fw:4), Python (Fw:1, sides:2), Wolf II (Fw:3).
Anaconda hold 3-3 lasers on all sides. Constrictor has 5 forward and 3 aft lasers.
Black Cobra IV and King Cobra has 3 forward lasers in the same central position.
DTT Heart of Gold has 4 + 2 + 5 + 5 lasers. DTT War Lance has 3 + 3 lasers.
EscortPack: Dual: Ghavial, Ophidian Escort, Wolf I, Triple: Arachnid, S8.
Staer9's ships with dual forward lasers: Cat, Ghavial, Iguana, Monitor II.
Staer9's Python Class Cruiser and Python ET Special got 2 lasers in all views.
Staer9's Asp Mark II Special has 3 forward and 3 aft lasers.
Staer9's Chameleon has 3 forward lasers in the same central position.
Staer9's Mussurana has 4 forward lasers in the same position (for 875kcr).
Stormbrewer has 3 forward lasers and gun subentitites, Vigilante has 5 + 5.
Vector has 3 forward and 2 aft lasers, aft ones in the same position.
See even more ships in the Wiki. Compatible with Random Hits Shipset OXP.
author: Norby

title: Planetfall Markets
description: Enable markets in Planetfall from Oolite 1.82
author: Norby

title: Reverse Control
description: Your ship's up-down and roll controls will be reversed in the aft view, so you can aim exactly as in the front view. The controls in left and right views are normalized also, you can use yaw keys (',' and '.') well. Inertia is implemented from Oolite v1.87 (in forward view too).
author: Norby, cag

title: Reverse Y Control
description: Your ship's up-down and roll controls will be equal in all views, but use the opposite vertical directions as ReverseControl.
author: Norby

conflict_oxps.description: ReverseControl

title: SafetyCatch
description: Prevent accidental Q-Bomb and other mine launches when using missiles. In addition when a fast activation key is set to this equipment then surely launch a missile and not a Q-Bomb.
author: Norby

title: SellAll
description: Sell all cargo in Interfaces and can sell to an alternative cutomer if the market is full.
author: Norby

title: Separated Lasers
description:
Multiple lasers will not heat up faster than single ones if there is at least 30m space between the mount points. Large ships can earn up to 5x firepower on broadsides! Multiple Pulse, Beam and Military Lasers, Eco Lasers with low energy usage and some Laser Cannons are also available in separated form. Press 'i' for more info.

Ships with separated laser mounts: Anaconda (aft and sides), Boa II (aft), Caduceus, Cat, DTT War Lance, Ghavial, Hornet, Iguana, Krait, Pitviper II, Stormbrewer, Vector, Wolf I, Wolf II (aft) and more, as defined in Multiple Lasers OXP.

Broadsides (5 lasers on sides): DTT Atlas, Heart of Gold, Serpent Class Cruiser.
Forward broadsides (5 separated forward lasers): Far Arm Corsair, Far Arm Hunter.
Broadsides in all 4 views: Kirin, Maelstrom.

Sniper Gun and Heavy Sniper Gun are also separable in SG variants of ships if there is enough space between mounts but Sapper is not separable.

Check the wiki for details.
author: Norby

title: ShipVersion
description: All ship get version numbers and bonuses with the version, NPCs get extra equipments scaled with the version.
author: Norby

title: Sniper Gun
description:
Sniper Gun is a strong long range laser placed outside of hull for the best cooling. Ships must hold a clearly visible big gun mount to use it: you find Asp SG, Boa SG, Cobra Mark III SG, Fer-de-Lance SG, Krait SG and Viper SG in high-tech shipyards. Press 'i' for more info about Heavy Sniper Gun and Sapper mode of this weapon.

        Heavy Sniper Gun has 2x power but need large ship like Python HSG, Python BattleCruiser or Prototype Boa.
        Sapper is the overdrive mode of Sniper Gun: deliver 5x more damage at point blank range than at max. range but use 5x energy and make double heat. The 5x hit is within 500m, 2x at 2km, 1x at 20km. Note the base damage/second value is only the half than in Sniper mode, so at and within 500m provide 2.5x more damage than a Sniper Gun in the same time.  Cause some damage when a shot narrowly misses the target and can mine asteroids. You can set auto or manual switching between Sniper Gun and Sapper using Sapper Mode equipment. Anti-Sapper equipments and Hard Shields almost negate the effect. Can not be separated and break your cloak when you fire. Overheat can damage Sapper and reduce it to Sniper Gun, in this case you must repair Sapper Mode.
author: Norby

title: Superhub for Extra Planets
description: Superhubs are built over some secondary planets also, in about every 5. systems as the main dock for big ships. Depends on Additional Planets, Stations for Extra Planets and Superhub.
author: Norby

title: Telescope
description: Extended targeting and scanning features, masslock borders and sniper ring.
author: Norby

optional_oxps.description: Extends the range of Telescope and scan even farther with Gravity Scanner.
Show the newest target detected by Telescope in the last line of Combat MFD.

title: Telescope Extender+Gravity Scanner
description: Extends the range of Telescope and scan even farther with Gravity Scanner. Depends on Telescope.
author: Norby

requires_oxps.description: Need Telescope OXP v1.8 or above.

title: The Collector
description: Find the rich man who collect historical spaceships and do the jobs he offer. Choose wisely, your choices will form the story.
author: mossfoot, Norby

title: Time Control
description: Set Time Acceleration with Injectors and Torus, clear in Red alert, Dock and near a Wormhole. Need a developer release of Oolite which is available at oolite.org right below the main release and identical in gameplay but contain TAF and other debug functions.
author: Norby

title: Torus To Sun Drive
description: Reach the Sun faster due to your Torus works better far from planetary masses. Practical when an addon moved the Sun farther. Moreover provide 2x time forwarding anywhere at Torus speeds when your weapons are offline.
author: Norby

title: Towbar
description: Introduces Salvaging: make money from derelict ships, earn high salvager rankings.
author: Norby

optional_oxps.description: Adds in-game configuration through Station Interfaces (F4) Config for AddOns.

title: Trail Detector
description: Buy Trail Detector to see engine trails of other ships up to a bit over scanner range. Requires Trails OXP.
author: Norby

requires_oxps.description: Need Trails OXP v1.6 or above.

title: Trails

author: Ramirez

title: Iron Raven

author: Ramirez, updated by Milo

title: Resistance Commander

title: Medical Anaconda
description: This OXP adds NPC \"Medical Anaconda\" Hospital Ships and their Moray Medical escorts to the game.
author: Ranthe

title: Auto S.O.S.
description: This simple transponder will automatically broadcast an S.O.S. distress signal when your ship comes under direct attack or Red Alert condition - and... 'S.O.S.' does mean *help*, doesn't it?
author: Reval

title: Auxiliary Pylon
description: FE Shipyards will modify your vessel's underbelly for an additional pylon. This auxiliary pylon is not for a missile, but for a special cargo pod. Cargo pods in the 10-50 TC range will be buyable on the Equipment interface once the pylon has been fitted.
author: Reval

title: Cargo Pods
description: Special goods pods with downworld frame adaptors, for attachment to the auxiliary pylon only. Capacities 10-60 TC. Pods are fully detachable and replaceable and now gain a 60 TC class variant.
author: Reval

title: Cargo Space Refit
description: A complete dismantling and refurbishment of a ship's utilizable interior, this radical refit has been found to double the hold capacity of most vessels.
author: Reval

title: Elite Trader
description: Already a meta-game, the Guild of Elite Traders subverts Galcop and turns everything toward Trade. Perks include anti-masslock, witchpoint refuel, a forever-clean record, constant ship-enhancement, bonuses, new ship, lodges, cloak, fast dock; and Market scores count toward Elite. Progress in Grade brings a further edge. But - do not kill!
author: Reval

title: Elite Trader Meta
description: Already a meta-game, the Guild of Elite Traders subverts Galcop and turns everything toward Trade. Perks include anti-masslock, witchpoint refuel, a forever-clean record, constant ship-enhancement, bonuses, new ship, lodges, cloak, fast dock; and Market scores count toward Elite. Progress in Grade brings a further edge. But - do not kill! Elite Trader Meta is an all-inclusive package featuring: Elite Trader, Auxiliary Pylon, Cargo Pods 10-50 TC, Cargo Space Refit, FE Ships, GETter HUD, Goods Containers 10-50 TC, and Overdrive.
author: Reval

title: FE Ships
description: Replace the core Oolite ships with their Frontier First Encounters equivalents. No graphics changes, only the ships' specs. Principal advantage: greater cargo capacities and, with FE Ships Player, the ability to fly the Gecko, Krait, Mamba, Sidewinder, and two Vipers.
author: Reval

title: FE Ships Player
description: Fly the Gecko, Krait, Mamba, Sidewinder, and two Vipers with Frontier First Encounters cargo and speed specifications. Bigger hold capacities across the board. Requires FE Ships.
author: Reval

title: GETter HUD
description: A compact Trader's HUD based on the standard HUD, with digital speed, re-coloured scanner, compass, gauges, MFD and legends. Cargo carried (with quantity) is shown in place of missile loadout, and shipowner, ship class and name, plus hold capacity are displayed just above the scanner. System's name is also displayed.
author: Reval

title: Goods Containers
description: Externally mounted cargo cannisters, 10-50 TC range, installed on any available missile hardpoints. (tech level 6+).
author: Reval

title: Merchanter's Zeal
description: Join the Merchanters' League for free, accurate, and succinct advice on buy- and sell-prices at every station in every system you visit. Advisories via the F4 Interface as well as witchpoint in-flight comms. MZ uses your trading history as its basis for buy-advice, and for sell-advice your own hold's manifest. It makes an ideal pairing with the lucrative More Moolah Market (MZ + MM = $$$)
author: Reval

title: More Moolah
description: An enhanced and extended Market for the zealous merchanter. 5 (five) new commodities for industrial and agricultural economies; 10 (ten) recast display aliases for the Oolite goods. Full descriptions and advice for all 18 commodities via the F8F8 Market screen. More variety, more realism, more trade possibilities, more moolah. MM makes an ideal pairing with Merchanter's Zeal (MM + MZ = $$$)
author: Reval

title: Overdrive
description: FE Shipyards will re-route part of your Jump circuitry, linking it to your vehicle's velocity-controller. When full speed is set, J-drive will engage in a limited mode, similar in effect to an injector, but silent, fluid, faster, and without the attendant fuel-waste. We call it the O-drive. To disengage it, decelerate to below your normal top speed.
author: Reval

title: Teleportation Drive
description: FE Shipyards will link your ASC and Injector circuitry to the Hyperspace motor, allowing the formation of a miniature wormhole between the ship and its destination station. With a tap of the 'i' button, space is folded and transport is instantaneous. We call it the T-drive (or the Tau-drive, or the Mu-drive, or the Ooh-drive, or the Moolah-drive...)
author: Reval
