title: Traffic Control
description:
Introduces the friendly voice of the main station traffic controller, who welcomes ships approaching the planet, guides them into the correct docking maneuvers and even says goodbye when they leave. Just don't linger in the station approach lane after you leave and get in the way, or else they won't be best pleased...

Recommended for new players learning how to dock manually, and for experienced players who want a bit of extra ambiance around main stations. Most messages from this OXP appear only if your ship does not have functional docking computers, but a few appear regardless, for example: Clear the lane, Commander! If you see a message that starts with 'Traffic Control:' then it is probably from this OXP.

This OXP is neutral for beginners and slightly biased against the experienced player, because it enforces (with fines and small but escalating bounties) a sensible rule against the use of cloaking devices in proximity to main stations... however, to be fair, it will not impose penalties if you pass undetected (or at least unidentified). Of course, requesting docking clearance or activating docking computers will transmit your identity to the station...

This OXP is compatible with all other OXPs, and includes considerations for Buoy Repair, ILS and AutoDock if those OXPs are also installed.
author: Thargoid, Milo
license: Creative Commons Attribution - Non-Commercial - Share Alike 4.0 license with clauses - see readme file

title: Vortex
description: Two new player ships - a brawling blockade runner and a military spec cargo hauler. Rare and expensive, but both are kitted out with a lot of powerful and unique features and abilities.
author: Thargoid
license: Creative Commons Attribution - Non-Commercial - Share Alike 3.0 license with clauses - see readme file

title: Welcome Mat
description: Information equipment to give system summary information on arrival.
author: Thargoid
license: Creative Commons Attribution - Non-Commercial - Share Alike 3.0 license with clauses - see readme file

title: Wildships
description: Four new ships plus the Kiota station variants.
author: Thargoid

title: Your Ad Here Constore Remover
description: Suppresses the Con Stores in YAH, leaving only the billboards
author: Thargoid
license: Creative Commons Attribution - Non-Commercial - Share Alike 3.0 license with clauses - see readme file

title: Your Ad Here Mobile
description: A little add-on OXP for Your Ad Here OXP. It introduces mobile ship-towed advertising billboards to the route one space lane of appropriate systems.
author: Thargoid

title: Your Ad Here Witchpoint Override
description: Suppresses the witchpoint billboards in YAH
author: Thargoid
license: Creative Commons Attribution - Non-Commercial - Share Alike 3.0 license with clauses - see readme file

title: TAU Rockhopper
description:
Adds the Rockhopper ship by Tiared Aerodynamics Unit to the game.  Press 'i' for more info.

	The Rockhopper is a relatively small cargo freighter with 80 TC cargo capacity, which makes up for its small storage with good maneuverability and combat capabilities. Available both to players and NPCs.
author: Theta Seven

title: Jaguar Company
description: Adds in an Elite group of pilots to patrol the space lanes in Anarchy, Feudal and Multi-Government systems. Jaguar Company can also be found sometimes in interstellar space.
author: Tricky

title: Extra Thargoids
description: Adds new types of Thargoid, which are to be encountered especially in interstellar space.
author: UK_Eliter
license: Creative Commons Attribution - Non-Commercial - Share Alike 4.0 license

conflict_oxps.description: Please remove the earlier, OXP version of this expansion pack.

title: Fer-de-Lance 3G
description: Adds a line of Fer-de-Lance ships. Player buyable.
author: UK_Eliter
license: Creative Commons Attribution - Non-Commercial - Share Alike 4.0 license

conflict_oxps.description: Please remove the earlier, OXP version of this expansion pack.
This expansion pack is an older version of the Fer-de-Lance 3G pack, and must be removed.

title: Harder Hermits
description: This expansion packs (further) toughens up some rock hermits.
author: UK_Eliter

title: Interstellar Tweaks
description: Adds variety to what happens in interstellar space (and makes Frame's FuelCollector OXP more compatible with Oolite >= 1.8).
author: UK_Eliter
license: Creative Commons Attribution - Non-Commercial - Share Alike 4.0 license

conflict_oxps.description: Please remove the earlier, OXP version of this expansion pack.

title: Nexus Missile
description: Provides various multi-warhead, semi-automatically-targetting, missiles. Available for purchase in various locations.
author: UK_Eliter
license: Creative Commons Attribution - Non-Commercial - Share Alike 4.0 license

conflict_oxps.description: Please remove the earlier, OXP version of this expansion pack.

title: SuperSidewinder
description: Adds an uber-version of the sidewinder. Player buyable.
author: UK_Eliter
license: Creative Commons Attribution - Non-Commercial - Share Alike 4.0 license

conflict_oxps.description: Please remove the earlier, OXP version of this expansion pack.

title: 3dFont
description: Small change to font, giving it slight 3d and less '86
author: Vincentz

title: Nova Lux HUD
description: The Nova Lux (New Light) HUD is the newest in spaceship cockpits, with all functions and features gathered in a slick futuristic design. It changes color based on conditions (Deepspace/Mass-Locked/Alert). It does, however, not brew coffee.
author: Vincentz

title: Auto Crosshairs
description: Once the equipment is purchased, the cross-hairs change shape to alert the pilot to the precise moment a target is centred. Please use responsibly - Wildefire Systems does not endorse or condone hostility between spacefarers. The equipment can be bought at space ports with a technological level of 11 or above, for 1750 credits.
author: Wildeblood

title: Bullet Drive
description: Bullet Drive makes game-play harder, not easier, but only very slightly. When at torus drive speeds manoeuvring is disabled and you travel in a straight line - like a bullet. Manoeuvring is not affected at fuel injection speed.
author: Wildeblood

title: Contracted Goods Reminder
description: If you are doing a cargo contract and mistakenly sell the goods on the market screen, this will immediately pop up a reminder that you needed that cargo to deliver elsewhere.
author: Wildeblood

title: Display Reputation
description: Displays your current reputations as a passenger, parcel and contract cargo carrier under the heading 'Reputation' on your ship's manifest screen.
author: Wildeblood & Commander McLane

title: Distant Realms
description: On the long-range navigation charts, replaces the galactic chart numbers with the real names of the various galactic regions.
author: Wildeblood

title: Clarified, Not Glarified
description: Solar glare effect driving you to distraction? Don't start drinking, join the League of Glare H8ers.
author: Wildeblood

title: Laserific Crosshairs
description: Adds a circular dial showing the laser heat level around the central cross-hairs. Compatible with most HUDs.
author: Wildeblood

title: Shieldtastic Crosshairs
description: Adds two semi-circular indicators, showing the state of the shields, around the central cross-hairs. Compatible with most HUDs.
author: Wildeblood

title: Station Self-Destruction Codes
description: It's incredible, the things you can buy.
author: Wildeblood

title: Undocumented Launch
description: For a small application filing fee, station masters will allow you to perform an emergency launch without filing a cargo manifest.
author: Wildeblood

title: Undocumented Launch
description: For a small application filing fee, station masters will allow you to perform an emergency launch without filing a cargo manifest.
author: Wildeblood

title: Untrumbled
description: Untrumbled removes a core game feature which some players find irritating, and prevents any possibility of vermin infestation, but does not cure existing infestations.
author: Wildeblood

title: Alerting Cross-hairs
description: Automatically varies the gun-sight cross-hairs according to the current danger level.
author: Wildeblood

title: Distant Suns
description: Distant Suns tweaks the appearance of every star individually. Every star has its colour set. Cooler red stars have their habitable planets close by and are easy to skim for fuel. Super-luminous blue-white stars are far removed from their habitable zone and sun-skimming is impractical. Some stars are named.
author: Wildeblood

title: Galaxy Names
description: On the long range navigation charts, replaces the galactic chart numbers with the real names of the various galactic regions.
author: Wildeblood

title: Dockside Services
description: De-nerdifies the \"Ship and Station Interfaces\" screen. (And fixes a spelling mistake in the ship registration screen, too.)
author: Wildeblood

title: Font: Standalone
description: Based on the OCR A Extended Font (http://sourceforge.net/projects/ocr-a-font/files/)
author: Ziraeal

title: ZygoUgo's Asteroids resources
description: resource files for ZygoUgo's asteroids. needed for the shady or noshaders addon
author: ZygoUgo, Michael -Amah- Doering

title: ZygoUgo's Buoy
description: ZygoUgo's flashy Buoy.
author: ZygoUgo, Michael -Amah- Doering

title: ZygoUgo's Explosions
description: ZygoUgo's fancier explosion effects.
author: ZygoUgo, Michael -Amah- Doering

title: Zygo Cinematic Sky & Nebulas
description: Adds a spectacular cinematic look to stars and nebulae.
author: ZygoUgo

title: ZygoUgo's Asteroids - noshaders
description: 7 different asteroid models by ZygoUgo. Doesn't need shaders.
author: ZygoUgo, Michael -Amah- Doering

title: ZygoUgo's Asteroids - shady
description: 7 different asteroid models by ZygoUgo. Needs shaders.
author: ZygoUgo, Michael -Amah- Doering

title: Cruzer
description: ace56's Cruzer, player and NPC versions available.
author: ace56
license: Creative Commons Attribution - Non-Commercial - Share Alike 3.0 license with clauses - see readme file

title: Hornet
description: ace56's Hornet, player and NPC versions available.
author: ace56
license: Creative Commons Attribution - Non-Commercial - Share Alike 3.0 license with clauses - see readme file

title: Night Adder
description: ace56's Night Adder, player and NPC versions available.
author: ace56
license: Creative Commons Attribution - Non-Commercial - Share Alike 3.0 license with clauses - see readme file

title: Long Way Round
description: Long Way Round mission in Galaxy 1
author: aegidian

title: Noshader Mimoriarty's Radical Logistics ships
description: This bundle adds following ships from Mimoriarty's Radical Logistics to the Ooniverse: The Yasen-N, the Skat, the Lira, to go along nicely with the default shipset of Oolite v1.80+ and/or for e.g. Computer with lowend graphics hardware.
author: Michael -Amah- Doering

title: buyable/sellable Yasen-N turrets.
description: Adds an upgrade path for the basic Yasen-N class ship by making the turret a buyable/sellable equipment. (Needs the Mimoriarty's RL ships and Shipstoragehelper
author: phkb, Michael -Amah- Doering

title: Noshader Z GrOovy Extra ships
description: This bundle adds following Z Groovy ships by Dertien the Ooniverse: Viper Raider and the Cobra AC (modelled after the BBC Micro Elite covership), to go along nicely with the default shipset of Oolite v1.80+ and/or for e.g. Computer with lowend graphics hardware.
author: Michael -Amah- Doering

title: Noshader Z GrOovy Variety Packs
description: This bundle adds following ships from Dertien's Z Groovy Variety Packs the Ooniverse: his 27 retextured Cobra Mk3s, 15 Cobra Mk1s, 9 Sidewinders and a YellOo Cab Moray Starboat, to go along nicely with the default shipset of Oolite v1.80+ and/or for e.g. Computer with lowend graphics hardware.
author: Michael -Amah- Doering

title: Noshader Griff's accessories
description: This bundle adds a variety of cargopods, asteroids, boulders and splinters. It is based on the original shader models and textures by Griff and was remade to go along nicely with the default shipset of Oolite v1.80+ and/or for e.g. Computer with lowend graphics hardware.
author: Michael -Amah- Doering

title: Noshader chunky exploding asteroids
description: This bundle adds an explosion effect to all asteroids. Depends on Noshader Griff's accessories.
author: Michael -Amah- Doering

title: Noshader Griff's accessories replace
description: This bundle *replaces* the default asteroids and cargo pods with the new ones from noshaders_accessories. (depends on Noshader Griff's accessories bundle)
author: Michael -Amah- Doering

title: Noshader Griff's alternate ships
description: This bundle adds alternates of the coreships like clean and scuffed Cobra Mk1 & Mk3, clean Mambas and Fer-de-Lances and a different Viper model. It is based on the original shader models and textures from Griff's coreships and was remade to go along nicely with the default shipset of Oolite v1.80+ and/or for e.g. Computer with lowend graphics hardware.
author: Michael -Amah- Doering

title: Noshader Griff's alternate stations
description: This bundle adds alternates of core stations like the blue icosahedron and a orange rock hermit. It is based on the original shader models and textures from Griff's coreships and was remade to go along nicely with the default shipset of Oolite v1.80+ and/or for e.g. Computer with lowend graphics hardware.
author: Michael -Amah- Doering

title: Noshader extra stations addon
description: This bundle *adds* different additional small, medium and large system stations based on Griff's old grey Coriolis, Trade Outpost and Dertien's Z_GrOovy SML Tetra and Octahedron and Ico Systemstations. (requires Noshader Z GrOovy station resources)
author: Michael -Amah- Doering

title: Noshader extra station resources
description: This bundle contains resource files for extra small, medium and large space stations. It is based on the original shader models and textures from Griff's old grey Coriolis, his Tradeoutpost and Dertien's Z_GrOovy SML and Systemstations and were remade to go along nicely with the default shipset of Oolite v1.80+ and/or for e.g. Computer with lowend graphics hardware.
author: Michael -Amah- Doering

title: Noshader Griff's extra ships
description: This bundle adds extra ships from other Elite versions (ArcElite,Amiga) like the Bug, Ophidian, Griffin Mk1, Hognose and Gnat. It is based on the original shader models and textures from Griff's coreships and was remade to go along nicely with the default shipset of Oolite v1.80+ and/or for e.g. Computer with lowend graphics hardware.
author: Michael -Amah- Doering

title: Noshader Griff's missing coreships
description: This bundle adds missing ships like the organic Thargoid, flyable Python or Sidwinder and the scuffed Cobra mk3 in default Oolite. It is based on the original shader models and textures from Griff's coreships and was remade to go along nicely with the default shipset of Oolite v1.80+ and/or for e.g. Computer with lowend graphics hardware.
author: Michael -Amah- Doering

title: Staer9/Smivs S9 Chopped Cobra
description: This oxp adds the Chopped Cobra by Staer9/Smivs. Can also be used on computers without a graphics card with shaders
author: Staer9, SMIVS, Michael -Amah- Doering

title: No shader Staer9's shipset
description: This oxp adds the ships made by Staer9 to be used on computers without a graphics card with shaders
author: Michael -Amah- Doering

title: Noshader stations for sfep
description: This bundle patches stations for extra planets using the default core stations and noshadered Griff's old grey Coriolis, Trade Outpost and Dertien's Z_GrOovy SML Tetra and Octahedron and Ico Systemstations instead. (requires stations for extra planets & Noshader extra stations resources)
author: Michael -Amah- Doering

title: Noshader fullsize textures stations
description: This bundle replaces the lower resolution textures of the Oolite Systemstations and/or Griff alternate and/or Z_GroOovy extra stations with high resolution ones.
author: Michael -Amah- Doering

title: Oolite v1.88 Base Shipset Normal and Specular/Gloss Maps
description: Adds normal and specular/gloss maps to the basic Oolite shipset, making use of version 1.88's new materials and lighting system. The normal maps in this expansion pack are made by Griff.
author: another_commander, Griff

title: Diso is Jupiter 8k
description: Converts Diso to Jupiter by fully retexturing it with an 8k diffuse texture. This is a demonstration of the custom planet texturing capabilities present in Oolite version 1.89 and later.

title: Lave is Earth 8k
description: Converts Lave to Earth by fully retexturing it with 8k diffuse + city lights and normal + specular (gloss) textures. This is a demonstration of the custom planet texturing capabilities present in Oolite version 1.89 and later.

title: Tionisla is Mars 8k
description: Converts Tionisla to Mars by fully retexturing it with 8k diffuse and normal textures. This is a demonstration of the custom planet texturing capabilities present in Oolite version 1.89 and later.

title: Zaonce is Venus 8k
description: Converts Zaonce to Venus by fully retexturing it with an 8k diffuse texture. This is a demonstration of the custom planet texturing capabilities present in Oolite version 1.89 and later.

title: Compass target mode autoswitch
description:
Automatically switch your ASC to target mode when in red alert and a target is locked.

The ASC gives a better idea of where the target is compared to the HUD indicator. In particular, it tells immediately if the target is ahead or behind.
author: Astrobe

title: Missiles modification
description: Modification of the behaviour of missiles: are not armed right after launch (no more 'missile in your face'), standard missile gains slightly ECM proof and hardened missiles are slightly less ECM proof. ECM may result in erractic behaviour for a short time for both types.
author: Astrobe

title: Space Crowds
description:
Adds random encounters in deep space.

Based on and inspired from E. Walch's Deep Space Pirates.
author: Astrobe

title: Wanted Posters
description: An add-on for Station Ads, Market Ads and YAH adding Wanted Posters of infamous villains to the mix.
author: BlackWolf, spara

title: Station Options
description: Utility for OXP's to allow pilots to configure equipment, read text when docked.
author: cag

title: telescope_StationOptions
description: Adds Station Options to access Telescope 1.15 options/readme using F4.
author: cag

conflict_oxps.description: Not needed for Telescope version >= 2.0 as it has its own station options.

title: Illegal Goods Tweak
description: Introduces interaction with Galcop customs when docking at a main station with contraband in the hold.
author: Capt Murphy

title: Pitviper
description: What the Boa II is to the trader, the Pitviper is to the bounty-hunter. It's a straightforward combat vessel, a bounty-hunters dream. (And thus a pirates nightmare, of course). A special characteristic of the pitviper is its forcefield-reinforced hull. This, together with the special design of the hull, enables the pilot to attack by ramming other ships. But be careful! If the speed is too high (or the opponents ship is really big), even a reinforced hull may break.
author: Captain Beatnik

title: Pitviper Mark II
description: Reinforced hull and cutting blades on each fuselage enables the pilot to attack smaller ships by careful ramming.
author: Captain Beatnik

title: Riredi
description: Adds some eye candy and background story to the ooniverse, a customized Riredi-system.
author: Captain Beatnik

title: Coluber HUD CH01
description: The Coluber HUD CH01 is a fully featured HUD with individual scales for each gauge and additional control lights for important equipment.
author: Captain Beatnik, Norby

title: Fighter HUD Mk. II
description: A HUD with instrument panel and polarized glass laser sight. 4 MFDs.
author: CaptKev, spara

title: Copperhead Mk II
description: An alternate start-up choice for Jameson's. Trade down and have enough credits to add kit right away.
author: CaptSolo

title: Cougar ST
description: Adds the legendary ship found in some versions of 8 bit Elite.
author: CaptSolo

title: I-Missile
description: Very fast, highly destructive, and ECM resistant. Simply the best missile on the market.
author: CaptSolo

title: SimonB's Ships
description: Adds a collection of Simon Bridge's ships from his Neolite OXP's, updated for Oolite 1.80+.
author: Simon Bridge, CaptSolo

title: Captain Solo's Good Fortune
description: Adds the very short 'Captain Solo's Good Fortune' book to your ship's library, how he won big playing poker the foolhardy way.
author: CaptSolo

requires_oxps.description: Requires the Ship's Library to be read

title: Torus Stations
description: Adds the massive single and double Torus main stations to a very few high tech worlds.
author: Murgh, Svengali, & CaptSolo

title: Deep Horizon Nav Buoy
description: Deep Horizon Nav Buoy
author: Cmdr. Cheyd

title: Camera Drones
description: Drone cameras which provide a variety of alternative external views for your ship
author: cim

title: Combat Simulator
description: Adds a combat simulator to the interfaces screen of some high-tech stations where you can set up controlled battles against particular opponents. Requires Ship Storage Helper.
author: cim

title: Communications Pack A
description: Adds lots of extra NPC communications to the game, increasing the variety of existing messages and also adding several new ones.
author: cim

title: Curse of the Black Sunspot
description: An informal mission for experienced players set in Chart 3
author: cim

title: Energy Bomb
description: The original indiscriminate superweapon. Available as primable equipment from TL:8 systems and above. Previous versions of this expansion pack are not compatible with Oolite 1.79 or later.
author: cim

title: Escort Formations
description: Vary the flight formations used by escort pilots to give some alternatives to the usual 'v' shape.
author: cim

title: Extracts from the Tre Clan
description: Adds the 'Extracts from the Tre Clan Addresses on Interplanetary Life' book to your ship's library, containing selected lectures from an experienced trader.
author: cim

requires_oxps.description: Requires the Ship's Library to be read

title: New Cargoes
description: New Cargoes adds over 100 new specialist trade goods to the 8 galaxies through the interfaces screen. In addition, a variety of new trading opportunities are available.
author: cim

title: Ship's Library
description: An e-reader for your ship which can read various books while docked - or with a purchasable upgrade, also while in flight. It comes with a ship's manual as an initial book, with other books available as separate expansion packs.
author: cim

title: Shipset Compatibility
description: Makes replacement shipsets compatible with Oolite 1.79
author: cim

title: Skilled NPCs
description: Enables higher-quality flight AI for routine NPCs. Can be configured with OXPConfig or Library for even more challenge.
author: cim

optional_oxps.description: Configuration options can be adjusted via this OXP.
Configuration options can be adjusted via this OXP.

title: System Features: Sunspots
description: Adds occasional sunspots to stars. Requires a shader-capable graphics card.
author: cim

title: Green Gecko XL
description: The Green Knights of Lago pilot these fearsome ships, which are reputedly armed with double-barrelled military lasers. Recommended for experienced players only!
author: Cody

title: Z-GrOovY Small System Stations
description: Adds the Octahedron Outpost and the Tetrahedron Depot to selected systems.
author: dertien, Griff, another_commander, phkb

title: Arachnid Mark 1 Fix
description: Fixes problems in Arachnid Mark 1.
author: Dybal

title: Barrel Roll
description: Adds a barrel roll function to your auto-pilot.
author: Dybal

title: Fireball Fix
description: Fixes problems in Fireball.
author: Dybal

title: NPC Energy Units
description:
Enables the energy units of all NPCs that have them installed.

Awards Extra or Naval Energy Units to NPCs based on their accuracy and energy recharge rate.

WARNING: this OXP makes NPCs much tougher, with severe consequences to game balance against the player - NOT for new Jamesons!
author: Dybal

conflict_oxps.description: Same functionality with different parameters.

optional_oxps.description: Helps balance this OXP by allowing NPC equipment to be damaged when shields are down.
Helps balance this OXP by allowing NPC equipment to be damaged when shields are down.
Upgrades shield recharge for ships with high energy recharge rate.

title: Save In Flight
description: Allows the player to save the game while in flight (must be stopped with nothing in scanner range)
author: Dybal

optional_oxps.description: BackgroundSet - effects, ambient sounds and images.

title: Serpent Class Cruiser Fix
description: Fixes problems in Serpent Class Cruiser.
author: Dybal

title: SniperLockPlus
description: SniperLock Plus software keeps you on target, at ranges longer than 5km, with off-center weapon compensation
author: Dybal

title: SniperLock Fix
description: Fixes a compatibility problem between SniperLock and Telescope.
author: Dybal

title: Rock Hermit Beacons
description: This OXP adds limited range beacons to the majority of the Rock Hermits, making them visible in Advanced Space Compass and 'In-system distances' Station screen if in range.
author: Dybal

title: Towbar Payout - Medium
description: Reduces Towbar's salvaged equipment payout.
author: Dybal

title: Font: DangerousSquare
description: Font based on Elite Dangerous
author: edgepixel

title: Font: Dosis
description: Font based on Google's webfont 'Dosis' designed by Edgar Tolentino and Pablo Impallari, as used by the game 'Elite:Dangerous', with icons from edgepixel's 'Dangerous Square' font.
author: edgepixel

title: Missile Beep
description: Plays beeps whenever a missile is targeted at you
author: hoqllnq

title: Scanner Alerting Enhancement
description: Pre-emptive identification and alerting of new ships on the scanner.
author: jh145

title: Bank of the Black Monks
description: Bank of the Black Monks invites you to undertake a short term financial pilgrimage for the Black Monks of St. Herod. In addition monasteries, that can be found in safe and advanced systems, sell blessed Holy Fuel. Beware of the Black Monk Gunships that persecute defaulters.
author: LittleBear, Griff, spara

title: Beer Cooler
description: Keep your beer cool even while sun skimming
author: maik

title: Target System Plugins
description: A collection of equipment items that expand the functionality of the player ship's target system: Short Range Snapshot, Target Memory Interface and Target Banking Module.
author: Nicholas Menchise

title: Primeable Equipment MFD
description: Displays a list of the player ship's primeable equipment in the order that it's primed and indicates the current selection.
author: Nicholas Menchise

title: Single-Use Witchdrive
description: Adds the option to buy a Single-Use Witchdrive for ships without a Witchdrive, that will break after one use. The drive is repairable, weights 2 tons and a second set of coils (weighting another ton) can be added, to allow a second use before repairs become necessary.
author: ocz

title: AutoDock
description: Gives players without a docking computer the ability to engage an autopilot docking sequence for a small charge.
author: phkb

title: Auto-Prime Equipment
description: Automatic priming of equipment when current MFD changes.
author: phkb

title: Black Market
description: Adds black markets to most Rock Hermits and some other stations.
author: phkb

title: Bounty System
description: (WIP) This OXP seeks to add depth and meaning to the bounty system by making crimes persistent (removing the old mechanic of having bounties slowly disappear over time). Bounties might persist, but they are not always visible in every location. A Warrant Scanner can be used by the player or NPC's to uncover bounties registered in other systems.
author: phkb

title: BroadcastComms MFD
description: Provides a way to send communications to other ships via a multi-function display and primable equipment.
author: phkb and Zireael

title: Bulk Cargo Processor
description: Allows players to dump or destroy all of a particular type of cargo in their hold while in flight.
author: phkb

title: Bulletin Board System
description: Adds an interface screen for local or event-driven mission opportunities.
author: phkb

title: Change View Sound
description: Plays a sound whenever the view direction is changed during flight.
author: phkb

title: CommsLog MFD
description: Stores all communications received by the player and displays them in a multi-function display.
author: phkb

title: Compressed F7 Layout
description: Moves all standard F7 data to the top of the screen, leaving no blank lines between data elements, including details from 'Distant Suns' and 'Explorers Club', if installed.
author: phkb

title: Contracts on Bulletin Board
description: Moves all cargo, passenger and parcel contracts onto the Bulletin Board
author: phkb

title: Damage Report MFD
description: Displays a list of damaged equipment in an MFD.
author: phkb

title: Death Comms
description: Gives pilots that get killed in battle a final comms message.
author: phkb

title: Display Current Course
description: Shows players current course on the galactic map when contract courses are shown
author: phkb

title: Email System
description: Adds an email system to the system interfaces screen.
author: phkb

title: Enhanced Passenger Contracts
description: Expansion to passenger contracts system.
author: phkb

optional_oxps.description: Can integrate with this version of Broadcast Comms MFD.
Can integrate with this version of Bounty System.

requires_oxps.description: Depends on BB for offering passenger contracts.

title: Equipment 'Sell Item' Color
description: Changes the color of all equipment items described as 'Sell' or 'Remove'
author: phkb

title: Equipment Storage
description: Allows ship equipment to be stored at main stations.
author: phkb

title: Escape Pod Tweaks
description: Adjusts how escape pods are processed at stations, particularly Rock Hermits.
author: phkb

title: phkb's Factory Paint Jobs: Adder
description: This bundle adds 27 new paint jobs for the Adder.
author: phkb

title: phkb's Factory Paint Jobs: Anaconda
description: This bundle adds 36 new paint jobs for the Anaconda.
author: phkb

title: phkb's Factory Paint Jobs: Asp Mk 2
description: This bundle adds 27 new paint jobs for the Asp Mk 2.
author: phkb

title: phkb's Factory Paint Jobs: Boa
description: This bundle adds 36 new paint jobs for the Boa.
author: phkb

title: phkb's Factory Paint Jobs: Boa Mk2
description: This bundle adds 36 new paint jobs for the Boa Mk2.
author: phkb

title: phkb's Factory Paint Jobs: Cobra Mk I
description: This bundle adds 27 new paint jobs for the Cobra Mk I.
author: phkb

title: phkb's Factory Paint Jobs: Fer De Lance
description: This bundle adds 27 new paint jobs for the Fer de Lance.
author: phkb

title: phkb's Factory Paint Jobs: Gecko
description: This bundle adds 27 new paint jobs for the Gecko.
author: phkb

title: phkb's Factory Paint Jobs: Krait
description: This bundle adds 27 new paint jobs for the Krait.
author: phkb

title: phkb's Factory Paint Jobs: Mamba
description: This bundle adds 27 new paint jobs for the Mamba and 14 for the Mamba Escort.
author: phkb

title: phkb's Factory Paint Jobs: Moray
description: This bundle adds 27 new paint jobs for the Moray and 14 for the Medical Boat.
author: phkb

title: phkb's Factory Paint Jobs: Python

title: Tionisla Orbital Graveyard
description: Adds the Tionisla Orbital Graveyard (from the novel 'The Dark Wheel') to the Tionisla system.
author: Selezen, Rxke, Arexack_Heretic, Eric Walch, Captain Kev, Svengali, Disembodied, Griff, gsagostinho, phkb

author: Selezen, Rxke, Arexack_Heretic, Eric Walch

author: Gnievmir, phkb

title: Retextures for WildShips Stations
description: Updates and refreshes the textures on all Kiota stations from the WildShips OXP, as well as stations from Orbital Stations.
author: phkb

title: XenonHUD
description:
This HUD puts most of the important scales (fuel, speed, laser temp, fore/aft shields and energy) around the crosshairs, but with a low alpha and a uniform colour to avoid distractions when fighting. It also moves other HUD elements to the edges of the screen, rather than grouping them around the scanner.

Feature summary:
- Centralised gauges around the crosshairs and giving them a uniform color.
- Fixes bug with witchspace destination label - shows next jump dest.
- Docked and inflight GUI huds.
- New crosshair images for each weapon type.
- Works with 16:10, 16:9 and 4:3 format displays.
- Allows 3rd party laser OXP's to configure the crosshairs.
- Automatic 40% glare reduction on all views.
- Automatically hides the HUD when an external view is selected.
- Implements the \"allow_big_gui\" option.
- Primable equipment allows HUD to be switched to \"hi-contrast\" mode, which is useful when sun-skimming.
- Amber color option
author: phkb

title: Xenon UI SW Economy Addition
description: Updated F6 Economy list to be compatible with SW Economy OXP.
author: phkb

author: Dertien, Griff, Amah

author: Popsch

author: Redspear, spara and collaborators

title: Alien Systems
description: Add flavour to non colonial systems based on inhabitant type
author: Redspear

title: Demand Driven Economy
description: Goal is to keep the reliability of the current trade model but not the monotony. Assigns each of the 8 economy types with a specific high-demand commodity. Population, productivity and tech level also exert some influence.
author: Redspear

title: Equipment by Ship Class
description:
Categorises ships according to three fields (size, tech, grade) and restricts/alters functionality of equipment accordingly. Press \"i\" for more information.
- - - - - - - - - -

Size Categories: Very Small; Small; Medium; Large; Huge
Tech Categories: Archaic; Low; Standard; High; Cutting Edge
Grade Categories: Service; Transit; Civilian; Military; Performance

Size and Tech categories are fixed but grade may be changed via a re-fit at a suitably equipped shipyard.

Each grade has a unique piece of equipment:

Service - Heat Shielding; Transit - Large Cargo Bay; Civilian - Passenger Berths; Military - Military Shields; Performance - Engine Supercharger (+ 0.05 LM unless ship is performance grade by default).
author: Redspear

title: Equipment by Ship Role
description: Alterations to pirate and escort equipment and availability.
author: Redspear

title: Escape Pod As Standard
description:
Awards Escape Pod to the player ship and makes it immune to damage. Press \"i\" for more information.
- - - - - - - - - -

By granting the player a free escape pod they can escape at the cost of their cargo.
It's the one piece of equipment in the core (non-ironman) game that typically leaves you disadvantaged when you use it.
Starting again (or at least reloading a save) would actually be a less costly action in a great many cases, so as freebies go this is of questionable monetary value.

It is however a way to keep a game and the 'player story' going that might otherwise need to be restarted. The player pays for a bad encounter rather than being destroyed by it.
The penalty is losing your cargo, and some (often extensive) damage to your equipment, without also paying a 1,000 credits for the privilege (which is not even affordable from the standard game start).
author: Redspear

title: Fighter-Explorers
description: Adds modified versions of the Krait and Mamba that have hyperdrives but only a pulse laser by default. Available to the player as budget fighters - neither can match the Asp for speed but both can outmanoeuvre it.
author: Redspear

title: Additional Planets SR: free bitmaps dusty
description: Provides 14 high resolution dusty planet/moon textures for use with the Additional Planets SR oxz.
author: Redspear

title: Additional Planets SR: free bitmaps icy
description: Provides 9 high resolution icy planet/moon textures for use with the Additional Planets SR oxz.
author: Redspear, spara and collaborators

title: Additional Planets SR: free bitmaps rocky
description: Provides 12 high resolution rocky planet/moon textures for use with the Additional Planets SR oxz.
author: Redspear, spara and collaborators

title: Galactic Hyperdrive Reimagined
description: More ritualistic form of galactic hyperjumping
author: Redspear

title: Hyperdrives
description: Limits fuel capacity (and therefore hyperspace range) according to equipped core-game items.
author: Redspear

title: Indesructible Injectors
description:
Awards Witchdrive Fuel Injectors to the player ship and makes them immune to damage. Press \"i\" for more information.
- - - - - - - - - -

It's not uncommon for the player to be attacked by large groups of pirates even in the early game (when the player ship is especially vulnerable).
By granting the player free injectors that are not subject to damage there is now a good chance to flee from such encounters.
Furthermore slower, more vulnerable starting ships are now more viable for the player.
As before, injector function is subject to fuel supply and so the player won't be able to run every time.
Non player ships don't always have injectors of course but then whether they don't have injectors or have simply run out of fuel is not obvious to the player.
author: Redspear

title: FdL Lightspeeder
description: 'Neo-Retro' Fer de Lance - a little faster, a little closer to the original 'elite' shape
author: Redspear

title: Masslock Compensator
description: Script to increase max ship speed during passive masslocks (yellow alert)
author: Redspear

title: Masslock Reimagined
description: Masslock delays (rather than always holds) torus drive
author: Redspear

title: Missile Combat Reimagined
description:
Makes standard missiles more useful by rebalancing missiles' relationship with ECM. Press 'i' for more information.
- - - - - - - - - -

The ECM is commonly equipped by non-player ships, often neutering the standard missile - one of the few weapons a new pilot can afford. By making ECM rarer, all missiles become more useful; in order to create a similar effect for the player, ECM is less commonly available and more fragile. Hardened missiles are made less available and more expensive but there are two new missile types: defence (cheap) and torpedo (powerful).
author: Redspear

title: New Lasers
description:
A simple mod to add several new lasers and laser colours to Oolite. Adds some of them to the core shipset as well as making them available to the player.
Press \"i\" for more information.
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

Combined with the core lasers, the options include:

Red: Pulse lasers - budget
     Ingram (range) and Ergon (cool-running) models
Orange: Defence lasers - slow heat up (yet reasonable fire-rate)
     Ingram MegaBlast (power) and Dual 22-18 (speed) models
Brown: Variscan lasers - multi-purpose (including mining)
     Volt (power) and Hassoni (budget) models
Yellow: Beam lasers - rapid-fire
     Ingram (range) and Ergon (cool-running) models
Green: Burst lasers - dogfighting
     Hassoni-Kruger (budget) and ColtMaster (power) models
Cyan: Cannon lasers - sniping
     Hassoni HiRad (power) and ColtMaster Starlaser (speed)
Blue: Mining lasers - specialist
     Ingram (standard) and JK (power) models
Magenta: Military lasers - combat versatility
     Lance & Ferman (range) and Ergon (cool-running) models

Also includes an option for enabling some silly/over-powered lasers:

Pulse laser: the Frontier-Newton Yr1993 PlasmaCharger. Much like a standard pulse laser except that it kills things. Colour: thargoid green.

Defence laser: the Williams PewPew 1982 ('R'-type model). Make laser overheating a thing of the past (along with careful aiming) with this medium fire-rate laser. Colour: rose (whatever that is).

VariScan laser: ZeusCorp's Thunderbolt will smash up pretty much anything into little bits. Not the fastest fire rate but it 'packs a wallop'. Colour: white/yellow.

Beam laser: the Lucas NegForce (SithField) Generator fires a stream of intense, awe-inspiring energy at the target over medium range. According to some, the awe wears off after several uses. Colour: pink.

Burst laser: the QVC Ubertron 4000 can be yours for a bargain price with this one-time limited edition special offer. Make other pilots regret 'looking at you funny' with just a second or two of trigger action. Satisfaction guaranteed... Not recommended for the short tempered. Colour: white.

Laser Cannon: the mysterious DeXM-trope DoomLens is hard to find but extremely formidable. Aim, fire, kill; only the first one is difficult. This will suck energy like nobodies business. Colour: black (of course).

Mining laser: the Anderson ITC 'Belter' Sp.(1999) hits with such a hard radioactive blast that it's amazing any of the rock survives. Can be used under duress to do similar to ships. Exhibits a strange technology ahead of its years. Colour: azure (I'm struggling here).

Military Laser: introducing the RimmerAce Quadcooled ImpasseResolver. Yes, it's four times 'cooler' than any other military laser and is also the four times winner of the 'shiniest barrel' award. It just oozes class (in a leak-free, non-radiation hazard sense of course). Colour: blue/green.
author: Redspear

title: Paddling Pool
description:
Turns the Leesti - Diso milk run into a much safer route for the beginning player. Press 'i' for more information.
- - - - - - - - - -

Neuters the piracy influence of many neighboring systems by altering their governmnet types and occasionally their economies to prevent further lucrative safe routes emerging.
It's not uncommon for the player to be attacked by large groups of pirates even in the early game (when the player ship is especially vulnerable).
Having a safe space to learn the ropes, within a single jump of Lave, is what this oxp attempts to provide.
The similarly nearby but potentially more lucrative routes of Zaonce/Tionisle - Isinor and Isinor - Ensoreous should be largely unaffected.
author: Redspear

title: Power To Engines
description: Grants more power to the player ship's engines (but not injectors) when weapons are off-line.
author: Redspear

title: Solos Alt Stations
description: Alternate Coriolis, Dodecahedron and Icosahedron stations
author: pagroove, Griff, CaptSolo, Redspear

title: Star Fuel
description: Script to produce superior injector fuel at some stars
author: Redspear

title: Tech Shuffle
description: Tech Level changes to equipment to promote gameplay. Fuel in (very)low tech systems might not be available. Cargo bay extensions snd ECM meanwhile both require high tech levels for instalation and repair. Therefore fuel scoops are more useful/interesting, missile combat is sometimes more dangerous and the gravy-train that is the large cargo bay is (slightly) discouraged
author: Redspear

title: Traffic Redistributer
description:
Manipulates system traffic to reduce time spent in mass-lock with minimal side-effects. Press 'i' for more information.
- - - - - - - - - -

Station bound traders are often headed in the same direction as the player and as such can contribute to some of the most time consuming and tedious mass-locks in the game. The basic idea here is to alter the probabilities of the various ships appearing to favour the slower ships without excluding any of the faster ones. Slower traders take less time (and/or fuel) to overtake and therefore result in more tolerable mass-locks.
author: Redspear

title: Weapon Laws
description:
Restricts the sale of more dangerous weapons to the more lawless systems. Press 'i' for more information.
- - - - - - - - - -

Military Lasers for sale in a Democracy?
Quirium Cascade Mines available in a Corporate State?
No wonder the galaxy has a piracy problem...
This expansion makes the more high end military equipment available only in the more dangerous systems. Tech level still applies but generally speaking the more dangerous the equipment, the more dangerous the system where you are likely to find it for sale.
author: Redspear

title: Dragonships
description: Three different low tec ships in a style based loosely on WW2 airplanes and a lot of artistic freedom. No shaders are used.
author: Christian Sturke aka Rorschachhamster, Montana05

title: Assassin Shipset Pack
description: Add ships from Random Hits, Feudal States and other ship OXPs to the Ooniverse for ambiance and challenge on the parcel and passenger missions.
author: Rustem

title: Dark Rainbow
description: Uber-Caduceus ship firing colorful plasma balls from 10 turrets.
author: sdrubble

title: SKS Plasma Mark I
description: From Silver Knight Shipyards on Diqudi in chart 3 comes the Plasma Mark I, a small multi-roll craft designed primarily for a pilot who is trying to make a living in the business of passenger carrying, and who, to be able to get contracts, must take the ones through more dangerous systems than most pilots would be willing to. From it's speed of 0.4 LM to it's patented SpaceCamo(tm), it is a craft that, wherever you go, assassins would have a hard time spotting you.
author: SirArian

title: Battle Damage
description: Causes damage to your hull when hit while shields are down. The damage should be repaired promptly to avoid problems.
author: Smivs

title: The Classic Mussurana
description: A modern update of Aegidian's classic Mussurana. This beautiful ship is a luxury executive express, but is also favoured by successful bounty-hunters and is perfect for small traders with a few Credits in the bank.
author: Smivs

title: The Classic Ships (Addition)
description: Modern re-imaginings of the classic Elite-style ships.
author: Smivs

title: The Classic Ships (Replace)
description: Replace the default ship set with modern re-imaginings of the classic Elite-style ships.
author: Smivs

title: The Classic X-ships
description: A beautiful modern re-work of some of Aegidian's X-ships. Includes the Asp-X, Cobra2-X (plus a new Courier/player version) and the Sidewinder-X (plus a new player version).
author: Smivs

title: Clippers
description: Long-legged variants of the Python and Boa Class Cruiser - faster but with less cargo space. Player buyable and NPC.
author: Smivs

title: CombatHUD
description: A fully-featured HUD with a neat, logical layout. At Red Alert vital information is presented around the crosshairs
author: Smivs

title: Delightful Docking
description: Delightful Docking aligns your ship with the station while queueing so you can watch the activity around the station, and includes an orchestral version of the Blue Danube docking music.
author: Smivs

title: Enigmas
description: Adds a collection of curiosities and strange alien species to your Ooniverse. Mostly harmless.
author: Smivs

requires_oxps.description: Adds bizarre giant Space Pizzas to the Ooniverse
Adds huge space 'jellyfish' to the Ooniverse.

title: Extra Fuel Tanks
description: Additional Reserve (1LY) and Auxiliary (3LY) fuel tanks. These are fitted internally and can be re-filled.
author: Smivs

title: GalDrivePod
description: A pylon-mounted portable Galactic Hyperdrive unit. This OXP allows for Galactic Jumps into 'un-reachable' systems that would normally be inaccessible. This will only be possible when you have a GalDrivePod installed.
author: Smivs

title: Giant Space Pizza
description: A light-hearted expansion which adds Giant Space Pizzas, Visitor Centres and Safety Stewards to selected systems. Visit them all to get a special award.
author: Smivs

title: Liners
description: Adds some beautiful and very large vessels to the spacelanes.
author: Smivs, P.A.Groove, Griff and Thargoid
license: Creative Commons Attribution - Non-Commercial - Share Alike 3.0 license

title: Smart HUD
description: The Smart HUD is a neatly laid out, fully featured HUD, with information grouped logically around the main scanner.
author: Smivs

title: Smivs Industries
description: A selection of equipment OXPs by Smivs
author: Smivs

requires_oxps.description: A handy tea-maker for your ship
Internal re-fillable reserve and auxiliary fuel tanks.

title: Star-jelly
description: Adds strange but beautiful Star-Jelly creatures to the Ooniverse, normally in asteroid fields.
author: Smivs

title: Aliens
description: Adds mysterious and unknown Alien ships to the Ooniverse.
author: Smivs

title: Better Buoys
description: Re-textures the (somewhat dull) default Navigation and Witchpoint buoys.  There are separate designs for the Navigation and Witchpoint buoys.
author: Smivs

title: Better Screens
description: Adds utilitarian backgrounds to the standard screens, for those who don't like black but don't want anything too fancy.
author: Smivs

title: The Classic Shipyard
description: Offers the player a variety of textures for each ship type in the shipyard.
author: Smivs

title: The Classic SuperPythons
description: This expansion adds updated versions of Aegidian's Python Class Cruiser and the Python Eunectes Turbo. Suitable for Oolite v1.80 upwards with high resolution graphics and updated code.
author: Smivs

title: The Classic Variety Pack
description: Adds 20 more Classic Ship textures to your Ooniverse. N.B. The Classic Ships required - either Addition or Replace version.
author: Smivs

title: Contractor MkII
description: Adds a lethal bounty-hunter/hit-man ship. Player buyable and NPC
author: Smivs

title: Cup of Tea
description: Buy a tea making machine. This will brew a lovely cup of tea in 15 seconds. Enjoy!
author: Smivs

title: Teretrurus
description:
the Teretrurus is a chopped Cobra MkIII, available with two colourful paint-jobs, the Purple Haze and the Shield-Tail.
Both are player-buyable, and will appear as NPCs from time to time.
author: Smivs

title: YellOo Cabs
description: Adds YellOo Cab taxis to the game. NPCs act as shuttles and inter-system taxis. The ship is player buyable.
author: Smivs

title: Technical Reference Library
description: Upgrade to Scanner Targetting Enhancement to show targeted ship's specs.
author: Spara

title: Aad-HUD
description: A HUD that enhances and reorganizes the default ones. Laser heat indicator integrated to the x-hair. Roll, pitch and yaw indicators integrated to the compass. MFDs' (4) positioned to the top corners and sides. Shield+energy positioned to the right.
author: spara

title: Additional Planets SR Base
description: Add persistent extra planets (max 4) to the system and moons (max 3) around the main planet and occasionally around other planets. At least one texture pack is required. Can be configured via Library Config or OXPConfig as System Redux.
author: Redspear, spara

title: Additional Planets SR Demux Gas Giants Pack
description: Texture pack for Additional Planets SR containing gas giant textures from System Demux by DrBeeb.
author: Redspear, spara and collaborators

title: Additional Planets SR Redux Pack
description: Texture pack for Additional Planets SR containing planet and moon textures from System Redux by (Kaks, CaptKev and Pagroove)
author: Redspear, spara and collaborators

title: Asteroid tweaks
description: Control asteroid respawning and the number of asteroids the game spawns at system creation. Configure settings via an interface screen.
author: spara

title: Audible docking clearance
description: Plays notification sounds for docking events, so you'll not miss the clearance messages. You'll need to have the Docking Clearance Protocol enabled from Game Options.
author: spara

title: Behemoth
description: Adds Galactic Navy Carriers to the game. Carriers include four different types of Behemoths and a Navy Class Carrier. In total 40 uniquely named carriers escorted by navy grade Vipers, Asps and Sidewinders.
author: ADCK, Aegidian, Griff, Eric Walch, PAGroove, SimonB, spara

title: Commodity Markets
description: Divides the price column to sell price and buy price. Buy price is always a little higher than sell price. This adds a little bit of difficulty and realism to the game.
author: spara, Thargoid

title: Countdown to Zero
description: BGS countdown goes down to zero while core countdown goes down to one. This oxp makes the core go down to zero too.
author: spara

title: Equipment Aide
description: Buying equipment costs credits and time. Too bad you don't know how long the service is going to take. This oxp overlays the purchase screen with a list of equipment prices and estimated times to give you some clue of the time cost.
author: spara

title: Glare Filter
description: Paint your ship with electroactive polymer solution that filters sun glare. Three levels of filtering are possible by conducting electricity to the hull of the ship. When used, the coating gradually degrades and needs to be replaced.
author: spara

title: Griff's Normalmapped Ships (Replace)
description: An all-in-one installation of Griff's normalmapped ships as a replacement set. Including ships, stations, missiles, escape capsule, cargo pods, asteroids and alloys and wreckage. Requires a video card capable of supporting Oolite Shaders. Balances the roles to match the core distribution.
author: Griff, spara

title: In-System Taxi
description: This oxp adds in-system passenger contracts to the game. Passenger Berth is required along with some extra stations. In-System Taxi Comms equipment allows you to get in-system passenger offers while cruising.
author: spara

title: Manifest MFD
description: Shows manifest information in an MFD. Great for miners, scavengers and others in constant need of cargo hold information.
author: spara

title: Market Ads
description: Enhances the market screen by showing ads when docked.
author: spara

title: Market Cooldown
description: Changes the game to remember markets when changing systems. The memory gradually fades away over time. This encourages to move a bit rather than zipping between two systems.
author: spara

title: Market Inquirer
description: Market Inquirer adds an MFD that shows the markets of the main station and selected stations closest to the player. ASC is needed. When docked, information about distances and markets is available from the interfaces (f4).
author: spara

title: Market Observer
description: Enhances the market screen by showing ads and trading information. Trade information includes statistical price data and purchase log. This oxp also gives a trader's rating based on your buys and sells.
author: spara

title: Market Observer
description: Enhances the market screen by showing trading information. Trade information includes price average, difference, percentual difference and purchase log. This oxp also gives a trader's rating based on your buys and sells.
author: spara

title: Commodity Markets
description: Divides the Market Observer's market screen's price column to sell price and buy price. Buy price is always a little higher than sell price. This adds a little bit of difficulty and realism to the game.
author: spara

title: Navigation MFD
description: Display navigational information in an MFD. Information includes data from hyperdrive system and space compass.
author: Mika Spara

title: Ore Processor
description: Don't accept lousy pay for mined minerals! The Ore Processor extracts any valuable material from scooped asteroid splinters. The equipment is sold at high tech shipyards and is every miner's dream.
author: Ark, Dr. Nil, Eric Walch, Kaks, spara

title: Random Hits
description: Random Hits adds seedy Space Bars to anarchy systems that offer large bounties on the galaxy's Most Wanted Criminals. This oxp adds Missions, Ships, Stations and Features.
author: Eric Walch, Little Bear, spara and contributors

title: Random Hits Shipset
description: Add ships from Random Hits to the Ooniverse for ambiance and challenge.
author: spara

title: Random Player/Ship Name
description: Add random pilot and random ship names to the ship registration interface. More variation to random ship names can be added with Random Ship Names OXP.
author: spara

title: Rescue Stations
description: The RRS Group is the leading specialist for official retrieval and rescue work. This OXP adds their stations and ships to some safe systems, where Commanders with a suitable reputation may find a variety of employment offers.
author: cim, spara

title: Simon B's Favorites
description: Adds Simon B's re-modelled versions of Aphid, Cobra Clipper, Cobra Clipper SAR, Cobra Rapier, Cobra Cutlass and Wolf Mark I. Original ship concepts by 8-Bit Apocalypse, Murgh, Wolfwood. Includes player and NPC ships.
author: Keeper, Simon B, spara

title: Stations for Extra Planets - Stations
description: A station pack of ~40 different stations for Stations for Extra Planets oxp. Shaders recommended.
author: spara and collaborators

title: Spicy hermits
description: Spices rock hermits to better fit their core roles by modifying their behavior and markets. Adds abandoned hermits to the game.
author: Mika Spara

title: Start Advice
description: A smoother start for the game. Popup an info screen for new Commanders with many advices, for example to buy Injectors first. Also offer a mini mission to teach how to deliver a package.
author: spara

title: Start Choices
description: This oxp gives you some start-up choices of various difficulty ranging from very easy to extremely hard. In addition the Adder is given a change to buy a 3 tn cargo expansion so it can be used for passenger transporting.
author: Mika Spara

title: Station Ads
description: Enhance busy system stations by decorating them with dock and front ads. Over 400 selected ads from YAH oxp and thread included. Compatible with the default and Griff's normalmapped system stations.
author: spara

title: Stations for Extra Planets Base
description: Adds stations to extra planets with atmosphere. Requires Additional Planets oxp and at least one station pack.
author: spara

title: Trophy Collector
description: Keep track of your kills. When in-flight, view your 10 last kills (Bounty Log) in an MFD. When docked, view your all-time kills (Trophy Collection) along with a kill log (Trophy Log) of 38 events in the interfaces screen.
author: spara

title: Your Ad Here Constores Only
description: Supress all billboards except Constores' own navigation billboard
author: spara
license: Creative Commons Attribution - Non-Commercial - Share Alike 4.0 license

title: Your Ad Here Fuel Station
description: Use ConStores as fuel stations. Be aware that this change makes the game considerably easier when allowing you to fuel right after hyperjump.
author: spara
license: Creative Commons Attribution - Non-Commercial - Share Alike 4.0 license

title: Your Ad Here Gem Casino
description: Adds casino games using gems as credits to the constores.
author: spara, CaptSolo
license: Creative Commons Attribution - Non-Commercial - Share Alike 4.0 license

title: Your Ad Here More Ads
description: Over 100 extra ads for Your Ad Here.
author: Dr. Nil and contributors
license: Creative Commons Attribution - Non-Commercial - Share Alike 4.0 license

title: Eagle Transporter
description: Eagle Transporter from Space: 1999 TV series is an ideal multirole ship, features small front profile, 75TC cargo and high speed. The Eagle Escort variant is better in combat without cargo capacity.
author: spud42, cbr

title: Star Destroyer
description: Imperial-class Star Destroyer is probably the largest and most powerful warship which is available in a few Shipyards, for astronomical cost. Longer than a station but can dock using a Shuttle or ILS. Hold 30 turrets and 72 TIE Fighters which counterattack automatically and cheap to replace.
author: Staer9, GGShinobi, Norby

title: Staer9/Smivs S9 Chopped Cobra (shader version)
description: This oxp adds the Chopped Cobra by Staer9/Smivs. Shader magic by Keeper. Shaders needed.
author: Staer9, SMIVS, amah, Keeper, spara

title: Staer9's Shipset
description: Adds 13 nice looking and nicely balanced ships to the game. Models and textures by Staer9. Custom shader and reworked textures by Keeper.
author: Staer9, Keeper

title: Darkside Moonshine Distillery
description: The Darkside Moonshine Distilleries are only found in a few systems in each chart, often clustered in poor agricultural regions. They offer a special commodity Witchfire Whiskey.
author: Stormrider

title: Manifest Scanner
description: The manifest scanner allows you to scan a ships cargo manifest and display it in a MFD when activated.
author: Stormrider

title: Combo F7 Layout
description: Moves all standard F7 data to the top of the screen. Modified to use with Sun Gear and SW Economy.
author: stranger

conflict_oxps.description: Similar functionality
Similar functionality

title: Dark Ray
description: This OXP turns off laser beam glow - not only your's laser but NPC laser too.
author: vasig & stranger

title: Energy Rebalance SCC
description: This OXP rebalances energy between shields and energy banks. If forward/aft shield level dropped below 25% of max capacity, energy from banks is transferred onto shield in question, preventing damage of equipment and cargo. Version compatible with Ship Configuration.
author: stranger & phkb

conflict_oxps.description: Conflicting functionality
Conflicting functionality
Conflicting functionality
Conflicting functionality

title: FPO Lave
description: 4K custom texture of Lave with diffuse and specular maps.
author: stranger

title: FPO Zaonce
description: 4K custom texture of Zaonce with diffuse and specular maps.
author: stranger

title: Habitable Main Planets
description: This OXP redefines main planets radii and visual appearance to values more suitable for advanced ecosystems and colonization.
author: stranger

title: Hard Eject
description: New insurance rules gives you after ejection ship in basic configuration. All lost upgrades displays on F5 screen as damaged. You may restore lost upgrades immediately if system TL allows it or later in system with adequate TL. Insurance covers 50% of lost equipment price.
author: stranger

conflict_oxps.description: Conflicting functionality
Conflicting logic

title: Hard Way
description: This OXP contains four modules, altering game mechanics: Collapsible Shields and Fuel Consumption, Gravity Well, Solar Wind Scoop, Warp Drive.
author: stranger

conflict_oxps.description: Conflicting functionality
Conflicting functionality

title: Here be Dragons
description: This OXP is addition to Explorer's Club. It allows permanent access to F7 system info only for already visited systems and temporary access for system info in 7 LY range. This is ocean of unexplored worlds beyond you horizon now.
author: stranger

conflict_oxps.description: Conflicting functionality

title: In-System Cargo Delivery
description: Open In-System Cargo Delivery mission interface on F4 screen, select mission, pick up cargo and deliver it onto port of destination. Time is not limited, but it is obligatory to perform mission without docking with any outside port.
author: stranger

title: Internal Fuel Tank
description: Single use 5 LY internal fuel tank. Mounts in cargo bay and requires 5 tons of free cargo space. Available on systems with TL 8 and more. Select and activate as primed equipment.
author: stranger

title: Leesti is Moon 8k
description: Converts Leesti to Moon using 8k diffuse + normal maps
author: stranger

title: Leesti is Moon LSM 8k
description: Converts Leesti to Moon using 8k diffuse + normal maps. Map with marked istorical landing sites.
author: stranger

title: Mineral Store Reset
description: This OXP helps to play in-system miner scenario, preventing saturation of main station market.
author: stranger

title: Moons
description: This OXP simulates (pseudo)dynamic moon configurations.
author: stranger

title: Moons Texture Pack
description: This is package of textures for Moons OXP.
author: stranger

title: Orbital Stations
description: This OXP simulates stations, moving on circular orbits.
author: stranger

title: Planetary Systems
description: This OXP simulates (pseudo)dynamic solar systems with terrestrial planets and gas giants.
author: stranger

conflict_oxps.description: Conflicting functionality

title: Planetary Systems Texture Pack A
description: Package of textures for Planetary Systems OXP - Ice Deserts.
author: stranger

title: Planetary Systems Texture Pack B
description: Textures for Planetary Systems OXP - Cold Deserts.
author: stranger

title: Planetary Systems Texture Pack C
description: Package of textures for Planetary Systems OXP - Hot Deserts.
author: stranger

title: Planetary Systems Texture Pack D
description: Package of textures for Planetary Systems OXP - Volcanic Deserts.
author: stranger

title: Planetary Systems Texture Pack E
description: Package of textures for Planetary Systems OXP - Cold Mars.
author: stranger

title: Planetary Systems Texture Pack F
description: Package of textures for Planetary Systems OXP - Dry Mars.
author: stranger

title: Planetary Systems Texture Pack G
description: Package of textures for Planetary Systems OXP - Gas and Ice Giants.
author: stranger

title: Planetary Systems Texture Pack H
description: Package of textures for Planetary Systems OXP - Mercury, Pluto, Venus analogs and super-earths.
author: stranger

title: SW Economy
description: New rebalanced set of market rules is implemented. Three new trade items declared: fresh water, oxygen and medicine.
author: stranger

title: SW HUD CAI
description: Overhauled version of CB HUD, supporting MFDs and other modern useful features. Requires Hard Way OXP to display altitude redefined in planet/moon radius. Conflicts with SW HUD DAI version.
author: stranger

conflict_oxps.description: Conflicting functionality

title: SW HUD DAI
description: Overhauled version of CB HUD, supporting MFDs and other modern useful features. Stand-alone version with default altitude indication. Conflicts with SW HUD CAI version.
author: stranger

conflict_oxps.description: Conflicting functionality

title: Sun Gear
description: This OXP simulates more realistic sun population based on real astronomical data. Vast solar systems with main planets in habitable zones and with simulated solar wind. Requires Habitable Main Planets OXP.
author: stranger

conflict_oxps.description: Similar functionality
Similar functionality

title: Traffic Lights
description:
This OXP helps to override annoying problem of frozen docking queue. Emergency docking timer will be started immediately after request to docking clearance and after 15 min of waiting you will receive docking priority.
In addition to text info this OXP provides visual helpers - string of colored flashers on approach lane between main station docking port and beacon.
author: stranger

conflict_oxps.description: Conflicting functionality

title: Start Choices Addenda
description: This oxp adds to Start Choices two extra start-ups: Expeditor Start - PLC equipped Transporter and Advanced Miner Start - Bushmaster with fuel scoop and mining laser.
author: stranger

title: Ship's Cat
description: Adds 9 individual ship's cats for purchase.
author: superbatprime

title: Chrysopelea MK-I
description: Adds the Chrysopelea MK-I to Oolite, a small ship with four missile slots, a good reacharge rate and reasonable maneuverability. Features PBR textures.
author: Tsoj

title: Her Imperial Majesty's Space Navy
description: A more 'believable' Navy presence that sits more comfortably in the Ooniverse as many of us see it. The Navy is there if you go looking. If you do your normal trading, mining and bounty hunting you will never see them. They do not, under any circumstances, meddle in internal system politics. So, you will not be attacked by the Navy if you are an offender or even a fugitive for that matter. That is a police matter.
author: Gimi, Pleb, Keeper, Smivs, Cody, Disembodied, Cholmondely, cbr, Tsoj

title: Secretarybird
description: Adds the Secretarybird to Oolite.
author: Tsoj

title: TEC Apep Mk II
description: Adds the fast TEC Apep Mk II.
author: Tsoj

title: Star System Lane Indicator
description: An upgrade to the compass, indicating lane position of spaceship in the current star system and/or a beacon to the nearest point of a lane.
author: wesfire

title: Xenon Redux UI
description:
Adds backgrounds to all screens, allowing for a narrower screen ratio (eg 4:3). Also includes new title screen music. Also requires the XenonReduxUIResources.oxz. For 16:9 screens, see Xenon UI.

This OXP will override any backgrounds currently applied by other OXP's. This is by design, in order to maintain the illusion of looking at a computer display. If conflicts arise, where important information needs to be given to the player via a background screen, code can be applied to allow exceptions to take place. See the Wiki page for more information.
author: phkb

requires_oxps.description: All images files are kept in the resources OXZ.

title: Xenon Redux UI Resources
description: Images file resources for the XenonReduxUI OXP
author: phkb

title: Xenon UI
description:
New background images all standard gui screens, plus new title screen theme music. Needs one of the Xenon UI Resources packs to be installed: Pack A, C, E, G, I, K or M for 16:9 screens, Pack B, D, F, H, J, L or N for 16:10 screens. Choose a pack that matches the font you are using - see resources pack details for information on which font is used.

This OXP will override any backgrounds currently applied by other OXP's. This is by design, in order to maintain the illusion of looking at a computer display. If conflicts arise, where important information needs to be given to the player via a background screen, code can be applied to allow exceptions to take place. See the Wiki page for more information.
author: phkb

title: Xenon UI Resources Pack A (16:9)
description: Background image resources (16:9 format) for the Xenon UI OXP
author: phkb

title: UsefulMFDs
description: Two MFDs: General Info (info on player and ship status) and  Market of Cargo (prices and quantities in main market for ship's cargo)
author: Zirael

title: Laser Colors
description: Changes laser color for all core player ships to orange. NPC laser remains red.

title: OrangED HUD
description: An orange-blue HUD inspired by a certain game.

title: Adder Mark II
description: 2 remakes of the legendary Adder Mk II. The Adder Mark II-R is a racer while the Adder Mark II-F is a fast, light fighter.
author: Ramon, Montana05

title: Mega Bat
description: A, based on the Fruit Bat and the Flying Fox, somewhat maneuverable medium fighter/escort. This ship is often used by pirates, assassins, hunters and escorts alike. For more details, please check the wiki page.
author: Montana05

title: Gecko 'Dragon Class'
description: A Gecko heavy fighter based on the technology of a wrecked Green Gecko from the Green Knights of Lago. Warning, this ship is significant stronger than most core-ships. For more details please check the wiki page.
author: Montana05

requires_oxps.description: Add effects, additional cargo and commodities plus new escape pods required by this OXP.

title: Far Arm Ships
description: Inspired by Paul Neurath's Space Rogue this OXP adds 10 ships (+variants) and 4 missiles to the Ooniverse.
author: Zieman

title: Enhanced Vipers
description: This OXP adds enhanced Viper Patrols, Viper Pursuits, and Viper Interceptors, to richer stable systems; GalCop Deputies to stable poor/average systems; and Bounty Hunters to unstable/dangerous systems. They are not ber ships - far from it - but with the advent of heavy pirates and heavy assassins into the core game, some toughening of GalCop Vipers seemed appropriate.
author: Montana05, Cody

title: Military Missile G1
description: An enhanced hardened missile. If the weapon is affected by ECM the intelligent S&D guidance system will seek nearby Thargoids or pirates, otherwise, the behavior is like a standard hardened missile.
author: Cmdr Wyvern

title: Military Missile G2
description: An enhanced hardened missile developed exclusively for the Galactic Navy and the GalCop police forces. The Military Missile G2 is the next generation after the G1. For more details please check the wiki page.
author: Wyvern, Montana05

title: Chimera Gunship Fix
description: Update of the Chimera Gunship: Fixes problems and adjusts to later Oolite versions
author: Montana05

title: Colonial Viper Mark I Restore
description: a restore of the 'lost' Colonial Viper Mark I
author: Montana05

title: Constitution Class Heavy Cruiser Fix
description: Update of Constitution Class Heavy Cruiser: Fixes problems and adjusts to later Oolite versions
author: Montana05

title: Cylon Raider Mark 1 Fix
description: Update of Cylon Raider Mark 1: Fixes problems and adjusts to later Oolite versions
author: Montana05

title: GalTech Escort Fighter Fix
description: Update of the GalTech Escort Fighter: Fixes problems and adjusts to later Oolite versions
author: Montana05

title: Kestrel & Falcon
description: The Benulobiweed Testing Department is proud to announce the reintroduction of both, Falcon and Kestrel, to the ooniverse.
author: Charlie

title: Nuit Space Station
description: A large space station which in some advanced systems with stable governments could be found next to the main planet. For more details please check the wiki page.
author: Killer Wolf, Griff, Montana05

title: Fruit Bat
description: A, somewhat manouvreable fighter/escort, often used by pirates, hunters and escorts alike. For more details please check the wiki page.
author: Rorschachhamster, Montana05

title: S.I.R.F.
description: System Independent Repair Facilities could be found in medium to high Tech level systems with reasonably safe governments. They provide alternative shipyards and trading. This package includes 3 NPC ships as well, for more details please check the wiki page.
author: milinks, tinker, Montana05

conflict_oxps.description: This original version and the simplified version are using the same keys and extensions and therefore can't coexist.

requires_oxps.description: Adds effects, additional cargo and commodities plus new escape pods required by this OXP.

title: S.I.R.F. (compact version)
description: This simplified version of S.I.R.F. features only the station, additional ships, cargo and effects are not included.
author: milinks, tinker, Montana05, Nite Owl

conflict_oxps.description: This simplified version and the original version are using the same keys and extensions and therefore can't coexist.

title: ADCK Imperial Trader
description: The Imperial Trader is an adaptation of the military vessel found in the service of the Achenar Empire. While inferior to the technology of the Imperial Navy this is a notable vessel for GalCop standards. For more details, please check the wiki page.
author: ADCK, Slartibartfast, Montana05

title: Fer-de-Pai
description: A remake of the Ferdepai, presenting a combination of a Fer-de-Lance and a Asp Mark II, abandoning the luxurious trimmings in exchange for military equipment.
author: Montana05

title: Bulk Haulers
description: Adds the Bulk Hauler, the Super Bulk Hauler, the Long Range Cruiser (FFE) and the Lynx Bulk Carrier (FFE) to Oolite.
author: ADCK

title: Snark
description: The snark is primarily a slow but powerful fighter, used by escorts, bounty hunters and pirates. For more details, please check the wiki page.
author: ADCK, Montana05

title: ADCK Wyvern Explorer
description: The Wyvern Explorer is an adaptation of a multi-purpose vessel found in the service of the Alliance. For more details, please check the wiki page.
author: ADCK, Montana05

title: Hognose
description: Originally developed by the Galactic Navy and Griff Industries for target practice, the ship nowadays is used for other purposes as well. Missionaries, scavengers and miners are flying the Hogose. For more details, please check the wiki page.
author: Griff, Montana05

title: Montanas Resource Pack 01
description: While mainly designed to support other OXP's a stand-alone download is adding Griff's alloy and the new commodity Quirium Crystal
author: Montana05

title: Firefly Class Transport
description: This multi-purpose,  medium-sized transport ship is a homage to the Firefly Class ship 'Serenity' from the firefly TV series. For more details please check the wiki page.
author: Staer9, Montana05

title: Thargoid Weaponry
description: This OXP brings you the Thargoid Ray Laser, the Thargoid Cannon and the Thargoid Plasma Accelerator. For more details please check the wiki page.
author: Nexus-Hex, Montana05

title: Griff's Glowroids
description: Glow Moss, they call it. Little is known about it, other than it's an organic lifeform living on asteroids. Once it gets a hold, it's very difficult to eradicate, hence its other name  Hermit's Bane.
author: Griff, Montana05, Nite Owl

title: HUD Toggle
description: A primable kit, use the 'n' key to make your HUD disappear/reappear (no pause needed). This tweak makes impulse eye-candy screenshots much simpler.
author: Cim, Cody

title: Outrider
description: A relatively well-fitted freighter escort, capable of offering serious resistance to the modern generation of fast attack ships. For more details, please check the wiki page.
author: Roberto, Montana05

title: Galactic SatNav
description: A navigation aid for long journeys
author: Wyn Sleeman
